Reviews.Title: “Really good!”
Reviews.Author: Ojal D
Reviews.Content: Great location, service and price. I would certainly recom others to stay here. This is certainly not a 5 diamond hotel or anything, but its worth the rate for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Top-Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: BrentlyNeel
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel with our eyes open, knowing it was not a five star, but saw some generally positive reviews and knew the location and amenities were what we were looking for. I am happy to say that our expectations were surpassed. The service, from the moment we walked in the door to our very early early departure just this morning, was fantastic. The hotel itself is older, but the lobby and our room were very clean and well-maintained. We got a suite which was large and very comfortable. The pool was great and the restaurant was a great value. The front desk staff were excellent and so helpful (special kudos to Mike). I can not say enough about Wallace, the concierge - one of the greatest ambassadors of Chicago I have met during my visits to this great city. We crammed a lot into our few days in Chicago, and from day one, as we walked back in the doors, exhausted after very busy days, this felt like home. Thanks so much to all the staff for a great vacation! Oh, and whoever arranged for the 80 degrees for 3 days straight (in March, yet!): thanks for that!!!

Reviews.Title: “HONEST REVIEW”
Reviews.Author: MOTOR-CITY-TRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago briefly on February of 2012 for site seeing and shopping. While in Chicago we wanted to stay at a hotel in downtown which was close to some of the attractions and shopping centers. While surfing through the net, we came across several hotels. What attracted us the most about 'BEST WESTERN PLUS' hotel was its location and free parking. Most everyone knows that downtown Chicago hotels are expensive and parking is not cheap. The hotels rates range from $150 to $500 a night and parking varies from $20 to $30 a day. Some places even charge more for parking if once you leave the facility and return. The Best Western Plus River North cost $109/night with king sized bed or $97 for AAA members and free parking. It is located in the center of all the action. One can walk, catch a cab, take the bus or train to any destination. The hotel has a huge lobby, restaurant, indoor pool on the roof, sit out patio next to the pool, and a small gym. The hotel is actually two different buildings connected together by a bridge. All four sided of the hotel over looks streets and other building in Chicago. The only side we found interesting was the McDonald's side. We were told that there were only a few rooms available which over looked the McDonald's and one would have to call in the morning of the day of arrival to reserve one of these rooms. The McDonald's is one of the biggest in the country, which is made of all glass and has two floors. It has an up/down escalator and elevators with luxurious contemporary sofa style seats. The view of McDonald's is fabulous from the inside and outside. Next to McDonald's are the Rain Forest Cafe, Hard Rock Cafe and the Sports Authority which has eight floors. The hotel has 6 floors with fast elevators, bright lights and clean halls with vending machines, ice makers, etc. We stayed in a room with King Size bed, which was very spacious, clean and quiet. The room also had a TV, desk/chair, a recliner chair, a safe for personal belongings, and coffee maker. The lighting was adequate and the bathroom had hair dryer and iron/ironing board. Although the tub was a little small for my taste, it was enough to just take a shower. The hotel had room service and free Wi-Fi. The hotel has no kids’ activity but provides a big lobby with a nice restaurant/bar. Free continental breakfast and coffee was also a plus. One thing we found while staying at the hotel was that they offered discount tickets to various attractions around the areas. For example: We visited the Shed's Aquarium, which was about 3 miles from the hotel. Shed's website charges $35 + $5 as on-line fee ($40) for an adult. At the hotel the same ticket cost $27, a savings of $13 for each adult, which was even better than the AAA rate. While in Chicago, keep in mind that the GPS in your car will keep losing signal due to the high rise buildings, long bridges and tunnels. Having a map handy will help you navigate better around town with less frustration. I hope this review helps everyone in determining if this is the best hotel for you. I have attached a few pictures of the place and its surrounding areas. If you like more information and additional pictures, feel free to email me at easy2talk2@hotmail.com and I'll do my best to help. Thanks for reading and hope you have a great trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Joanne Z
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk are very accommodating and helpful. The location is good and the parking is free. The room was large and recently renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: javo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has free parking which is mighty rare to find in Chicago. The self parking is very accessible and convenient. There are dozens of restaurants within a 10 minute walk. The hotel restaurant is very reasonable for breakfast. Our king room was huge with lots of good lighting for readers. There is a lovely pool and exercise area on the top floor. Staff was uniformly friendly and very knowledgeable. We found the bed very comfortable. We booked via the Best Western site in advance and got a rate of 87 dollars a night. With taxes it came to $101 per night. When we asked to extend our stay another night we were offered the same rate. The neighborhood is a great walking area and very safe. Just across the street is the rock and roll McDonalds, the Hard Rock Cafe and the Rainforest Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Free parking!”
Reviews.Author: trvlbug2
Reviews.Content: Great location. Free parking. Pool. The layout, design of hotel is a bit out-dated but our room was modern. Nothing special but a great value compared to other hotels in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The great deal is not so great”
Reviews.Author: Anu_Wi
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Chicago on business a lot lately and I stayed at the Best Western this week as the hotel I have been staying at was booked and the free parking was enticing. I had a TERRIBLE night! I had the worst hotel experience of all my travels, and I have traveled a lot! The beds/pillows were hard as rocks, the room is run down, the entrance is through a dingy dirty parking ramp, the corner of Ohio/Clark is busy with traffic all night, there were people partying till late and to top it all off, the vending/ice machine were right outside my room and churning ice all night. I think I got 2 hours of sleep. My iron did not work and they did act quickly to bring me a brand new. Overall I thought the service was great, friendly people including the parking attendant. The hotel is not great! Not sure why it is rated so high online. If you are traveling on business and need to be refreshed in the morning, don't stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Free Parking and super-clean, what more can you want?”
Reviews.Author: mona_sydd_yma
Reviews.Content: A deceptively inexpensive hotel in downtown Chicago offers free parking and free wi-fi. This is the second time I've stayed there and will make it my regular Chicago hotel. This time, I got a king room and it was much larger than the double for the same low price. Spotless throughout. However, there were no black-out blinds and ambient neon light from the street poured in. Also, there was some street noise, although once I was asleep, it didn't wake me up. Courteous staff. Pillows were kind of firm. If you check in in the afternoon and want a nap or privacy, be sure to put the Do Not Disturb sign on your door (I learned that last time), as room service does come around in the late afternoon. Convenient outlets for computer (so you don't have to do the unplug-the-clock thing).

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: JulieLove13
Reviews.Content: The Best Western River North has everything I need when I stay in Chicago. The rooms are large, the beds are comfortable and the location is within walking distance of many restaurants, bars, and The Magnificent Mile. If you drive your own vehicle into the city, this is the place to stay for sure, as the parking is free! The staff is always friendly and accommodating. I had only one complaint the last time I stayed...all of the vending machines were out of bottled water and it was a Friday night...they should have been full. The water at the bar was ridiculously expensive, but I bought it, because I didn't want to go back out to the store. I dealt with it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Front Desk Staff!”
Reviews.Author: ynpgal047
Reviews.Content: We wandered in after making our way to Chicago by train for a quick escape from Indy and found a great group of employees who were sincerely friendly and went out of their way to make us feel welcomed and oriented for our first trip to this city. If any of them read this... we can't wait to see the Facebook video of you guys doing that dance!! Our room was newly remodeled and looked fresh and was very clean, including the bathroom. I suppose it would be called small, but we don't care about size and it was very comfortable. If I had one thing to say about this hotel, it would be please don't come here. Because we want to keep this great gem as quiet as possible, so we can be sure to get a room anytime. We don't want to risk it becoming too popular! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel......”
Reviews.Author: elliemae4780
Reviews.Content: We're not city drivers or city dwellers. The location of this hotel is perfect! Free parking is definitely the greatest thing. The staff are helpful and very nice. This is the only place we stay when we go to Chicago,.

Reviews.Title: “cozy, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: packerfans50
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nights for a long anniversary weekend. The rooms were small, but cozy, with comfortable beds. Parking was free which was great because we just got CTA passes and used mass transit for all of our sightseeing. You can buy CTA passes at the Walgreens 2 blocks away, but get free maps at el locations. We felt very safe walking anywhere and most attractions were even close enough to walk to. The pool was awkward to reach and the fitness room was waaay too warm. Overall a great value

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: dawnp53
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a recent business trip to Chicago, and I wasn't expecting much--thinking that the property might be dated and at first I thought the location wasn't that great. But I was (pleasantly) wrong on several points. This hotel had parking included, which is a huge value. We had a unit with a king sized bed, second floor, that was quiet ( back side of the building, not facing Ohio) and the bedding was comfortable, modern, and clean. Another surprise was being able to walk to the Merchandise Mart, and there are several great restaurants and clubs within a few blocks--such as Rick Steves Fontera Grill and Blues Chicago. Great winter time values as well. Great experience, and we'll stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: GmaCC89
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. Great location, superior service and free parking to boot. One of the best buys in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect centrally located place in downtown Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: katerinamyl
Reviews.Content: The staff were very polite, helpful, knowledgeable and accomodating. It really is a BIG plus that the parking is free. Much of the sites and food venues were within walking distance. A free trolley ride to Navy Pier allowed us to enjoy the landscape and the lake. This is a great spot to enjoy what Chicago has to offer. Will definitely come here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hospitable”
Reviews.Author: RiverAngelShawanoWI
Reviews.Content: The entire staff starting in the parking area, front desk etc. went out of their way to make everything pleasant. It was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A great Value”
Reviews.Author: Cubsin45
Reviews.Content: Had a 8-day business stay. Very well run hotel - excellent desk staff, particularly Mike. A warm friendly staff. Restaurant is a very nice addition to the hotel with good, simple food and fairly priced drinks. Very good location with some inexpensive restaurants, Walgreens and groceries near by. It is a older property but very clean and gives a good value if you are looking for comfortable accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel room should be!”
Reviews.Author: paym01
Reviews.Content: Not too fancy, but just a very comfortable room to relax and rest while checking out the windy city. For the price, I believe the best deal one can find in Downtown Chicago. Pros: great location, very clean, comfortable bed, free in room wifi, cable, LCD TV, free parking with in and out privileges Cons: loud heater no refrigerator

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in the City”
Reviews.Author: ClevTNTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights just before Christmas. It was very close to many of the things that we were interested in seeing. There were numerous places within just a couple of blocks to eat. For staying in the city, the rates were very good. We will definitely consider staying at this hotel again when we make it back to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: Barb M
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I recently stayed here and we couldn't have been happier! This hotel is conveniently located to the Mag Mile and easy walking distance to shopping, restaurants, Hancock building, etc. Our room was spacious, beautiful and appeared to be recently updated. You won't find a better value!

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Ann032
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here when we went to the opera, shopping, etc. It is in a great location - close to lots of restaurants (including Rick Bayless' 3 restaurants, Naha, and plenty kids would like), Michigan Avenue shopping, and close enough to walk to State St. shopping, the opera, etc. Staff here was very helpful. Free parking in downtown Chicago is hard to beat! Breakfasts were decent and staff were pleasant and prompt. Rooms are fairly basic, but are clean and have all that you would need. Ours was good sized, had a safe, flat screen LCD TV, shower and toilet separate from sink. Shower control is a little tricky - ask how to work it when you check in. USA Today paper every morning. Pool and workout room on top floor. Maps and good suggestions from staff at desk.

Reviews.Title: “chicago christmas vacation”
Reviews.Author: Billiejo h
Reviews.Content: This was the first time in Chicago for me. The hotel is a great price! The location is perfect! Easily accessible to and from airport using the CTA transportation.Walking distance to most venues. The service is friendly, rooms are clean, The restaurant in the hotel is affordable and good. I would recommend this to anyone that wants to go to Chicago with a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Free parking!”
Reviews.Author: iatigger
Reviews.Content: The free parking is what pulled me to this hotel but I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the room and friendliness of the staff. We were able to buy one day bus passes at the front desk to get to the museums. The staff were helpful directing us to wherever we were trying to get to. We ate at the Pizzaria Ora restaurant which is in the hotel and had very good thin crust pizza. The hotel is also located across from the biggest McDonalds I have seen and Rain Forest Cafe and Hard Rock Cafe is next to that so food is handy. The only thing I wasn't sure about was the pool. It was cloudy when we went to look at it so we did not use it. Not sure if there were too many chemicals or not enough. But other than that we were very pleased with our experience at this hotel and would definately recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ME-and-CA-Smith
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River North for three nights this past week and couldn't have been more pleased. First of all, the hotel is immaculate, something about which I'm unreasonably particular. Our room (a king plus, I believe it's called) was enormous, with more than enough room for us, our two young adult children and our two visiting grandchildren. The staff was courteous and responsive. One spring on our sofa bed was missing and once we mentioned it to the room cleaner, maintenance was there within five minutes and it was fixed within ten. The location couldn't be better, and, as anyone who's spent time in Chicago knows, the parking is an incredible bonus. We will definitely be back! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Location and free parking the only plus!”
Reviews.Author: Heidi G
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, within walking distance to many restaurants and the MIchigan Avenue. The free parking is definitely a plus! The parking attendants were wonderful especially since we had a handicap person with us. But the front desk staff was very rude! My family were actually ignored on several occasions during the check in process. The indoor pool is advertised as a heated pool. The water and air was extremely cold and we could not enjoy ourselves. On two encounters the cleaning staff I ran into in the hallways were inconsiderate. We ate at the hotel restaurant for breakfast and we were the only ones in there and we still had to wait an extremely long period of time. The food was not worth the price. For location, I would recommend this hotel. But for service I would not!

Reviews.Title: “Better then the best”
Reviews.Author: Ellindblue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hoted for 4 nights last week. We were in town for a family emergency and the hotel and it's marvelous staff made us feel we were home. Our room was wonderful...clean, comfortable and large. I have nothing but praise...the parking is Free and that is worth at least $30.00 per night and the room rates were very reasonable...the restaurant and lounge was a haven with delicious food and very reasonably priced...best of all was the staff. We travel quite a bit and by far hands down the staff at this hotel is the best...helpful, courteous and most of all friendly beyond belief...this is the only place to stay when in downtown Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: Neil M
Reviews.Content: This is the absolute best place to stay in Chicago. Extremely affordable. The hotel staff was extremely friendly. The room was very clean and had a great view from our room. The hotel is located just a couple of blocks from a jewel osco and near some great restaurants. And the parking. Free parking!!! We even asked to keep our car there a few hours after check out and they said it was more than ok. Metro stops (bus and rail) are also very close by. We will definitely be back to stay at this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DMGWisconsin
Reviews.Content: When staying near Michigan Avenue, this is the place to stay. Parking is free if you stay here, which is so worth it. However, they will park you in so you better plan to walk. Which is so easy to do as everything is nearby. Navy Pier was only 1.5 miles away and Shed Aquarium was onlyh 2 miles. Everything you needed was within walking distance The staff was very helpful and willing to help with anything. The pool and outdoor desk area offfered great views, however the outdoor desk is not very useful in December, unless you dress in layers. On-site bar and restaurant is convenient. Great location and view from our window.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: bett10
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just got back from a two-night stay at this hotel. We were in Chicago for appt's at Northwestern Hospital. Very convenient to the hospital; free parking was great; close to shopping and restaurants. The hotel staff was helpful and courteous. They put us near an elevator which was very helpful due to my sister's medical condition. Room was large, clean and updated. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: shlawson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while visiting Chicago and the stay there exceded our expectations. The room was large and very nice. The people there were great. They went out of their way to make our stay a great one. They helped us arrange tours and lead us in the right direction to get the most of our stay. I would stay here again and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: kimND
Reviews.Content: We ALWAYS stay here when traveling with the family. Location is GREAT, very clean, free parking, comfortable beds, helpful staff, good pizza restaurant downstairs. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: college_prof_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here overnight during the Thanksgiving break away from relatives and kids and were very pleased with the choice. It's one of the few (maybe only) downtown Chicago hotels that offers free parking and is well located to walk to interesting restaurants and Michigan Avenue shopping. The hotel has a nice indoor rooftop pool (but not jacuzzi..slightly disappointing) and well-appointed rooms and everything's very clean.. The room decor is distinctive and pleasing (cool greens & grays) and staff friendly if not fully informed (a desk clerk recommended a restaurant that had been out of business for 5 months and a bill for the night got slid under our door though we'd booked via Skoosh-- a mistake readily remedied but shouldn't have happened!) Also Internet was down part of the time. But that may not happen often: we talked to a self-identified business traveler on the (small!) elevator who volunteered that he'd stayed there repeatedly over a number of years and always been satisfied. To avoid city garbage truck noise that other posts warn against, we requested a room on the top (5th) floor. The noise did wake me anyway, but not for long, and probably unavoidable in a cty. The hotel was quiet inside although fully booked and with some families. Booking tip: we had got what we thought was a best possible rate by booking with a discount service about 6 weeks in advance. I felt glad of the foresight when I checked again about 3 days in advance with the hotel website (as we could cancel the other booking), for the hotel was totally sold out. But, surprisingly, the bill slipped under the door was for $25. LESS than we'd paid! Another time we'd find the best refundable rate well in advance but check about 1-2 weeks in advance directly on the hotel site, which might offer the best deals. We'll in any case likely stay here again, which we can't say about many of the hotels in the north-of- Chicago-loop area we've tried.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: heatherh1313
Reviews.Content: Although we only stayed here 1 night and didn't get a chance to experience breakfast, we were met with very friendly employees and had a smooth check in/check out process. The location couldn't have been better. There was so much to see and do within walking distance from the hotel, I wish we could have spent more time there. The reason for our trip was to go to the Bears game and they were gracious enough to let us park at the hotel until the game was over later that evening with no charge, even though we were due to check out that morning. The parking was free to begin with so that was another nice feature of the hotel. I would definitely choose this hotel again if/when I return to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Plus Chicago was the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: BattleCreek1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just great! Parking attendants were friendly and Wallace was super helpful and friendly! I even received a call from the hotel to let us know we left something behind in the hotel room! Have left things at several hotels and when we call to see if they found of course they never have so to have received a call from them was so refreshing. Will definatley be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but pricy”
Reviews.Author: ProComputerGeek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel when we took our daughter to DePaul for auditions for admittance earlier this year. We got the king suite. The suite was incredibly spacious, the bed was very comfortable, and the pillows were good. I was in the middle of negotiations to get my house sold and they allowed me to receive and send faxes during the stay at no additional charge. It's a couple of blocks from a Red Line station so is very convenient to get to transportation. We got a deal on the room when we stayed there that was good, but the rates were nearly $300 per night the other trips we've taken so far. It's difficult to find decent places to stay in Chicago for less than $200 per night so the rates are a general issue rather than an issue with this particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “River North Best Western is where we always stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ratfacegirl
Reviews.Content: The rates are reasonable, the property is well kept, the employees are friendly, the room is nice. I only wish there was a fridge in the room for our leftovers! The parking is free, but you might be parked in...they have the keys if that happens and will be able to get you out but it may take a bit. We love this hotel and use it a lot. It's across the street from the rock and roll McDonald's, easy to get to and you can walk to just about anywhere. I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western River North”
Reviews.Author: Brandi N
Reviews.Content: We stayed here August of 2010 and had a great experience. We were in the remodeled part of the hotel. The room was very comfortable and had an awesome view. The staff was great, especially the front desk staff. We got there before check in and our room was not ready so they held our luggage for us so we could start exploring the city. We didn't make it to the pool so can't say much about that. The valet parking system is a bit confusing but since it's free, it's totally forgivable! We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, has it's not so great things too”
Reviews.Author: pghgirl1077
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for business and my boss booked us at the Best Western, it wouldn't have been my choice for sure. The location is perfect. It's right near Mag Mile for shopping and so many other attractions so if you want to be close, this is a great place. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go which was great. They do have free parking which in this town, is a huge bonus. The rooms are really outdated. The bathroom was pretty gross (squishy liner and assorted other issues) and it is a noisy hotel overall. If you are a light sleeper, this isn't the place for you. I have to say, outdated room and noise aside, the staff at this hotel is top notch. They go out of their way to be helpful and are so friendly, I was totally impressed. I had problems with the lock on my door and they handled it immediately and apologized for the problem. They had tons of recommendations of places to eat/drink and sights to see. The friendliness of the staff and the location outweighed the rest of the not so great things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: akn64
Reviews.Content: We were able to use the online coupon where you can upgrade the standard room to a suite for a $10 charge. This worked out well for us (3 travelers) because the suite we were given had 2 double beds and 1 pull-out sofa bed and we could all have our own bed. The room was dated and older, but of a good size. There were plenty of pillows on the beds and towels in the bathroom. There were a lot of families with young children/babies staying on the night we were there (a Thursday night) and it was loud with their noise. Also, it sounded as if several women were staing in a room next to us who were possiblydrinking and having fun and making a whole lot of noise. It was just a very noisy evening, and I don't know if that is normal for this hotel, because it was my first time staying here. I appreciated parking in the attached lot. We only stayed for one evening, however, we could keep our car in the lot until 5 p.m. the day we checked out, which I felt to be very reasonable and helpful as we spent some time in the city before leaving. We did not use the pool, however, we did stop by to take a look at it, and it was good-sized and had a deep end of 8 feet. There was no hot tub, which I would have liked. The elevator was really small. All-in-all, I felt it was a good place to stay. The location is about 6 blocks from Michigan Avenue, but really just a short walk. The access on-and-off the expressway was very good. I would recommend this hotel, but just be aware it is an older property and looks it.

Reviews.Title: “Not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: mjb358
Reviews.Content: Chosen based on co-worker recommendation, and Tripadvisor reviews. The hotel staff were tremendously friendly, and helpful. Faultless, really. But the street noise... Wow. We were on the 3rd floor, overlooking the corner of Ohio and LaSalle. A pretty cool view, but the street noise was constant, and LOUD. Get as far away from the ground as possible. But Chicago is a city of sirens. If you're downtown, you'll hear them frequently, and it seems, more at night. Loved the suite. It was spacious, and clean. But the place shows its age. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom is small, by today's standards. Would I go back? No. I'm a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Choose this hotel on your trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Lynn244
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel.We really like Best Western hotels, but the FREE parking was a great bonus. We arrived early with no problem.We were told we could park and check in later.The man at the front desk (Mike) was fantastic,every front desk employee should be like him. he was friendly and helpful.Every time we entered the hotel,he greeted us as though we were his good friends.The room was very clean.We were on the sixth floor and had a good view.There is a restaurant on site,the breakfast was really good.We purchased a bus pass ($11.50 for 2 people for 24 hrs) It was a great value.When we return to Chicago-this is what we would do again.it was a short walk to the stops,and we were able to go to Millenium Park,Grant Park,Navy Pier,Willis(Sears)tower,John Hancock Observatory and other attractions.We were able to walk to Gino's Pizza for lunch(great)and Ed Debovick's for dinner We stayed in 8 hotels on a vacation and this was the best.(some of the others were great, also- but because of Mike and his warmness we rated it our best.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: PetunianPorky
Reviews.Content: After alot of research we still did not know what to expect when we decided on this hotel. We didn't have to worry. From the minute we arrived Mike was there to greet us with a smile, friendly personality and wanted to help in any way he could. We sure had a few laughs with him throughout the weekend! Every time we entire this hotel we were greeted warmly by everyone from the front desk, parking attendantsto cleaning staff. The hotel was clean, shower was powerful and our king suite had plenty of room for the 4 of us. Our favorite part of this hotel was the deck! Our jaws dropped when we walked out of the pool onto the deck and saw the skyline! We spent plenty of time out there just enjoying the view of downtown Chicago and all of the city lights! It was close enough to walk to any place we wanted to go and had easy access to all the public transportation. The pizza at the restaurant was the best we've ever had. The bartender and wait staff were friendly, personable and efficient. We would highly recommend this hotel and will stay again when we return to Chicago to enjoy all it has to offer! I only wish they had microwaves in the room to reheat leftovers from the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a very reasonable Chicago adventure.”
Reviews.Author: ConductorWI
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times for business and with family. Love the "Parking included"! Always very friendly staff. Location is very handy, great dinning within walking or taxi. Rooms always clean, some are a bit small but not bad, comfortable beds. Restaurant on property is reasonable. Some hotel packages available through Chicago attractions--check on the web! This place makes going to Chicago on a budget very appealing--will return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel & staff!”
Reviews.Author: gram2trips
Reviews.Content: After much hotel searching online, I felt this Best Western woudl be the "bang for our buck" I was not wrong!! From arrival to departure it was great. Free parking was added bonus. I have a handicap tag & my car was parked outside of the door leading to an elevator. Room was very clean & bright, nice decor. I was a bit disappointed because there is no hot tub & the pool water was a bit on the colder side for this time of year. Pizzeria Ora has good food, & room service was punctual. Would defineately stay here again when back in Chicago. Kudos to Michael & Anthony! PS: I gave the sleep quality an average because I can't sleep well on harder beds with my bad back & hips.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms & staff”
Reviews.Author: annyong1
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights here for our wedding. We upgraded to the king suite and it was well worth it (separate living area which made getting ready for the wedding easy). The room was very clean & comfortable. Everyone on staff was friendly. The pool exceeded expectations - plus it had a deck. I would absolutely stay here again, but would book earlier than we did b/c prices went pretty high over the weekend (my guess is more weddings, bears game, film fest). Still a good deal though esp with the free parking. My only complaint was that streets & san was working on Ohio ave starting at midnight, not the hotels fault but readers should know to bring ear plugs just in case of construction or more 5 alarm fires. (typical city noise) heard from a low-mid rise building.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great value and great location! But specify which room you want if you are a light sleeper.”
Reviews.Author: shazam10
Reviews.Content: I am of two minds here. On the one hand. The rooms are really nice, the value is exceptional, the free parking is unbeatable and I would recommend this hotel to anyone. But on the other hand we were placed in a room that is close to Blue Chicago on Clark (which has performances every night of the week) and the music is loud and it didn't stop until about 1 or 2am. Both of us were light sleepers so it effectively ruined our sleep. I know we could have complained and get moved to another room but we decided to put up with it. The other thing which was a little bit annoying but nothing to spoil our stay was that I had two pieces of clothing taken by accident by house keeping. But like I said it wasn't anything to spoil my stay, just a bit annoying. Overall, despite the noise and the missing clothes, I'd still recommend it. You won't find anything better in value and the free parking really gives the joint a competitive advantage. I've given it a very good rating but only just.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again in a Heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: KCG79
Reviews.Content: Being a long time hotel employee myself I can be a bit picky about hotel services...I was very impressed by this hotel. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but that doesn't bother me since I usually spend very little time in the room when traveling. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and personable - we had quite a few dealings with Brenden at the front desk who always greeted us with a smile and went out of his way to answer our questions. I've worked at 4 diamond properties for years and am very well versed in the standards; the staff at Best Western was up to par with a luxury hotel. The only complaint I would have about the service is a minor one - we had stored luggage after we checked out; we went to the front desk to retrieve it and the woman at the front desk called the bellman who was obviously very busy and tied up with other guests. Instead of getting our luggage herself she made us wait 10-15 minutes until he could help us. In a 4 diamond hotel something like this would never happen but this isn't a luxury hotel so maybe I'm expecting too much...it just struck me as a bit odd. Had we been in a rush to catch a flight, this would have been a much bigger issue but fortunately we had plenty of time. I try to make it to Chicago as often as possible...this will be my hotel of choice from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff, location, free parking”
Reviews.Author: JudyWestBend
Reviews.Content: Our departure was delayed and we were pretty much camped out in the lobby for a couple hours. The staff was patient and so helpful. There were plenty of restaurant choices close by. Rooms were clean and rates very affordable. I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great value...”
Reviews.Author: CaneRidgeJohnny
Reviews.Content: Selected this property based on the much lower room rate compared to other area hotels, free parking and breakfast and TripAdvisor ratings and being fairly close to an L station; very happy with the results.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: bumblebee83
Reviews.Content: Chicago was our first stop on our route 66 trip across America. Finding the hotel was nice and easy and once we were checked in we were allowed to go and park our car in the main carpark which looked safe enough. The room we got was way bigger than we expected and everything was lovely and clean, with a huge bed, coffee making facilities, a sofa and table area aswell as a desk and a huge bed and 2 flat screen TVs!! The only slight downside was that the windows were too high to look out of due to the aircon unit being on the window sill but that didnt bother us one bit - who wants to stay in their room in Chicago and only look out of the window?? The staff were extremely friendly checking in and offered help with our cases. There was a pool that we looked at but didnt use, seemed nice enough but looked better for kids than adults. We went out to explore and had a lovely walk down to the Navy Pier which wasnt too far away. The Pier was well worth a trip and we enjoyed our first beer whilst watching a live band play. There were plenty of shops and places to eat. We chose the Hard Rock cafe which was nice and close to the hotel. My husband had a pulled pork sandwich and I had a burger (although I much preferred his!). The room was nice and quiet, we didnt hear anyone all evening apart from a little traffic noise outside. Check out was just as easy as check in and overall we had a brilliant time in this hotel - I wouldnt hesitate to go back there or recommend it to my friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “well situated hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bready207
Reviews.Content: Free parking and a pool with comfortable bed, relaxing colour scheme in bedroom and helpful staff made this a hotel one I would recommend if staying in Chicago.Within walking distance of many attractions it is well situated without being very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels in Chicago for the same price.”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoFLResident
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on my second visit to Chicago. This hotel is a bit run down. You can tell that they have recently made some improvements and upgrades to this hotel, but it is still not very nice. It was not extremely dirty or unsafe, nothing was old or damaged, but it was not clean and comfortable and not somewhere I would stay again. The staff was not helpful at all from helping us with directions to a room key that did not work to assisting us with luggage upon arrival. Everyone who stayed at this hotel with me agrees we will not be coming back and we would rather stay at the original hotel we tried in Chicago. On a positive note, this hotel is conveniently located to most of the fantastic shopping and attractions Chicago has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Super Weekend and the Cubs WON!”
Reviews.Author: Bruce297w
Reviews.Content: What a Wonderful weekend. This Hotel was Easy to get to and Find with their Sign Out Front. Pulled into the Free and Secure Parking Garage and then Checked in. Went to the Cubs Game with my Son Via Taxi for $20.00 Tip Included and Enjoyed the Wonderful Sights and Game at Wrigley Field. Brought the L Train back and the Hotel was only a Couple of Blocks from the Terminal. Enjoyed the Evening at Harry Cary's, House of Blues, Several Local Pubs All within Short Walking Distance and then Returned to the Hotel Pizzeria Ora for an Excellent Deep Dish Pizza at a Pleasant Price. Hotel Staff were Friendly and the Room was Excellent. The Best Part!!! The Room was Free with my Best Western Points. I'll be Going Back for the Christmas Sights!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to downtown but a little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Geewhiz08
Reviews.Content: I recently took my daughters to Chicago for a girls weekend. I had done alot or research online prior to making reservations at this hotel. When we first arrived, we were a little early and tried to check in and were told our room wouldn't be ready until 3:00 pm. No problem, we were hungry so we went and got something to eat and came back at 3:00. the lobby was a disaster! People standing around waiting for a room (over 40 people!) the front desk was completely unorganized and kept telling us that our rooms weren't ready. We ended up standing there waiting for almost an hour to check into our room! We finally get to our room - which was very nice I might add, a small sitting area with a fold out loveseat/bed, flat screen tv and desk and a second room with a king sized bed, another flat screen and dressers. Well we started hearing loud banging noises next to our room repeatedly! Our room was next to a storage room so I was afraid to know what was going on in there! I called the front desk and they sent someone to check it out. Turns out the swimming pool was directly over our room and what we were hearing was people jumping inn and out of the pool! The maintenance man acted surprised to learn that this was occuring! Give me a break! I cant be the first person to stay in this room and complain about the very loud banging noise! No one offered to change our room, give us a discount or anything else! We had to live with this for the entire 4 days we were there!! If it werent for the free parking I don't know that I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not inexpensive but very good”
Reviews.Author: twincopagirl
Reviews.Content: I was tired of paying to house my car in downtown Chicago and remembered this location from when I lived in Chicago. It has been rehabbed and the room was great - very well decorated and functional. There was a coffeemaker in the room, of course but also coffee service in the lobby as well as a computer for hotel guests. I was able to walk to the Ritz-Carlton where I was working and the car was not used until we drove away. All so easy! We were able to do self-park and could retrieve items from the car when necessary I am sure we paid the maximum hotel rate as there were 2 conventions in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price plus free parking”
Reviews.Author: MichiganWoodster
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel and I would definately stay again. The location is great, just a few short blocks from Michigan Ave and if you are driving into town, you cannot beat the free parking. Staff was very friendly and room was very clean. Loved the roof top pool and patio. The only down side was that the pull out couch in our suite was listed to sleep 2, but it was clearly only a single so we had to rent a cot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and free parking!”
Reviews.Author: laurenjamie816
Reviews.Content: Great find. I did a lot of research trying to find a budget hotel in downtown Chicago. This was the only one that did not charge an arm and a leg for parking (itâ€™s actually FREE). It is in a great location, the room was clean, comfortable and quiet. The staff was helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel IF travelling with children or on a budget”
Reviews.Author: evarett
Reviews.Content: I would recommend a stay at Best Western River North, Chicago IF you are travelling with children. All in all, this one falls under, you get what you pay for. The Service Nothing terribly special about the service although everyone was friendly enough. The check in / out processes were quick. The concierge service was helpful and did assist us in purchasing discounted tickets to the city tour bus. The Room The room was nothing special but it was clean. The view from our room was of a back alleyway and was actually quite uncomfortable as our windows were only 10 feet across from a series of residential balconies. The walls are paper thin, as are the ceilings. Normally not complainers, we had to call the front desk to ask them to request the party above us stop stomping/jumping at 11pm. The desk complied and for the most part the noise subsided. None of us slept well unfortunately. We had a coupon to upgrade to a suite, however at 3pm they were sold out of suites. Amenities Once you figure out which elevator to take to the pool be prepared to be at a splash party. Admittadly not a huge kid person, the pool was infested at all times with tons of kids and kid toys. A quiet adult swim from perhaps 9-10 before the pool closes would have been appreciated. The free wifi does not work except for very early in the morning when few guests are on. Be prepared to hand over your car keys on arrival, your car will be parked for you and only accessible upon request. We were not prepared for that and it caused a bit of a rush to unload the car with limited parking space but the attendants were nice. Location The location was great and the best part of this hotel, most notably close to the hop on / hop on tour bus stop, within walking distance to the Miracle Mile and to good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for sightseeing in Chicago. The only hotel includes free parking!”
Reviews.Author: heheharhar13579
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very convenient. A lot of restaurants nearby within walking distance such as Mcdonald's, Portillo's, Hardrock Cafe, Rainforest Cafe, etc. You can walk to Michigan Ave. (The Magnificent Mile) in minutes. The rooms are newly renovated. The staffs are very friendly. Don't forget to purchase your tickets for various attractions in Chicago at the hotel desk as they offer tickets at a discounted price and could save you a lot of money on admission fees. We only knew this at the last day of our stay and is not benefits from it. May I suggest the hotel should post a flyer in every room so that hotel guests are well inform ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great price”
Reviews.Author: spiels
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for a couple nights and a had a great time. Rooms were small and elevators slow, but location was GREAT and free parking was the kicker that made us pick this hotel. We had easy walks to Mag mile, Oak street beach, Millenium Park, and Navy Pier. Short drive to Wrigley and Lincoln Park Zoo. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Ace21206
Reviews.Content: Two of the highlights for this hotel was in a great location and the free parking! We received a Ford Employee discount that also included free breakfast off the menu in the hotel restaurant each morning and a free pint of Ben & Jerry's ice cream each night. The concierge in the lobby was so friendly, offering us tips on night life and gave us some discounted coupons for area attractions. The rooms were clean and spacious. Our second floor room over looking the street and we could not hear any noise from the traffic. Easy walk to Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier and Sears Tower. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be coming back!”
Reviews.Author: DaJenster
Reviews.Content: As maid of honor, my job was to orchestrate the bachelorette party. I had planned a "stay-cation" in our beautiful downtown. We needed a room that would fit 6 girls comfortably and the Best Western was the only one that offered everything we needed for a great price and more. 2 words anyone would love to hear in downtown chicago..."FREE PARKING" and omg WITH Complimentary Valet (i was floored!). OMG, this made our life so much easier. The hotel is centrally located near all of the bars and clubs, across the street from Rock and Roll Mcdonalds (which we made our 3am walk) and we are surrounded by the most friendly staff you can meet. Our family suite was impressively large, we had the corner room of the building on 6th floor. Stepping off of the small elevator you are left directly if front of your room, which looks like a very small area. Walking in you are lead to a rather LArge living room, complete with a couch, table, a desk w/ a chair and a little fridge and coffee maker in the corner. Down a small corridor leads you to a large bedroom with 2 queen size beds with windows that takes the whole wall (view of Ohio and Lasalle)that is across from a smaller but ok bathroom,. Attached is ANOTHER large room with a king size bed and a TV with a view to the Ohio and Lasalle street. We all slept VERY comfortable with no complaints what-so-ever. Any questions were answered quickly and professionally. We will definitely be coming back and having another "Stay-cation" soon! Thanks guys! love ya!

Reviews.Title: “Good value. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: kannika092
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and convenient to all of Chicago's attractions. Within walking distance to Miracle Mile and near free trolley service. It is not fancy, but I would recomend it and would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: jodee1018
Reviews.Content: The staff was absolutely wonderful! Every question we had was answered promptly and they gave us great advice. They helped us book an architectural boat tour, which we loved. Also, when we left, they shook our hands and wished us a good trip. All of this sounds so insignificant by itself, but paired with the clean room, amazing location, and free parking - this is a hotel I will definitely be back to and recommend to anyone going to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Guy next to me said..."Well it looked good in the pictures"”
Reviews.Author: AlanWithAnEh
Reviews.Content: This was our honeymoon. A bit of a budget so we saved on the parking. It is an older building so don't expect modernism. Our room was cozy but gets the job done. An older building. For the most part the pictures are accurate...you get a chessboard bathroom. We had a side bathroom to the sink counter with a door that closes tightly to the toilet or gets caught on the shower mat with the door clearance. Oh yeah...in room safe in the sink area -- was a nice surprise. I have a pool at home. That pool was more insanitary than say a public swimming pool. I would never let kids swim in that dirty water. Poor ventilation left the pool air heavy and icky. I said to my wife, "We came, we saw, we are going back to our room." and the husband with his family standing next to us joked "Well it looked good in the pictures." On the plus side...one of the hugest McDonalds I have ever seen on the opposite side of the road for that late night ice cream treat. Free parking and a solid working wi-fi is definitely a plus with access all over downtown within a 15 minute walk or a 10-20 minute bus ride. High notes nearby: Rainforest Cafe, Hard Rock Cafe, Gino's East Pizza, Uno's Pizza, movie theaters, Walgreen's, Magnificent Mile...restaurants all over within a block or two from this hotel. It does make up for the shortcomings in the pool / space. The in-house bar / restaurant / breakfast is good for the value and our waitress/front desk staff was very sweet and polite. There are passes available to buses, museums and stuff from the from desk for equal or better value. Get them at the front desk to venues like Shedd Aquarium or be forced to wait in huge lineups at the gate. I could give this 4/5 but the hotel itself is not getting the high marks...just the location, the staff friendliness and the free parking/wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “WOW...Our new hotel for EVERY Chicago trip!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleSerena
Reviews.Content: Our love of this hotel started prior to even arriving! My husband is from Chicago, so we spend A LOT of time there visiting family. We booked our vacation in March 2010, only to find out in May 2010 that our dates needed to change.......when we called a young man named Brendon was so accommodating that I actually posted a compliment on the hotel's Facebook page about him! When we arrived to the hotel with 2 kids (newborn included) we honestly joked that we were treated like we were at a 5 star hotel...everyone from the doorman, parking assistants, front door staff and attached restaurant were fantastic! (BTW, the deep dish is to die for...better than Gino's East, Seriously!) Our room was gigantic, clean, and modern...the pool and patio were awesome and kept clean (we called for towels a few times, and they arrived within minutes). Truthfully I could go on and on about the ease, modernness, amenities, parking, wi-fi, pool, location, staff, deep dish at restaurant......haha! We will be back SOON!

Reviews.Title: “Great room and value”
Reviews.Author: RandBArmstrong
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect and from the moment we got there until we left everyone was so helpful. The free parking was great, we pre-registered early so we could catch the red line to Wrigley Field and then after the game we checked in and then on our last day we were able to check out and leave the car parked there until 5pm. The location wasn't far from anything. The rooms were clean, service was always pleasant and timely. The elevators were slow so we used the stairs majority of the time since it's only 5 floors. We didn't use the pool or gym but it was a nice setup and would hopefully in the future. We would absolutely stay there next time we go to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great room for the money”
Reviews.Author: jburms5
Reviews.Content: Whenever we are in Chicago, we stay here - rooms are very clean and reasonable, free parking, friendly staff, and excellent location. This hotel is the best deal in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great price for great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMel63
Reviews.Content: The price was comparable to that of many lesser quality hotels, especially when you factor in the free onsite partking. We arrived in mid-afternoon, barely unpacked and walked right down to Navy Pier and then walked back to do shopping in heart of downtown until the shops closed. The next morning, I walked to and from an appointment aacross from the Sears Tower, an easy walk of less than 11/2 miles (I'm 47 and NOT a power walker). Everything was so convenient, we didn't move the car until we were ready to leave! Plenty of diners and dives right in the area that we'd seen hyped on Food Network tv shows, too. Ed Debevics and Al's beef were maybe three blocks away; if you're into chains, Rock and Roll McDonalds, Rainforest Cafe and Hard Rock are right across the street too. The pool was being renovated when we visited, so we didn't get to take advantage of that view, but then again we're not diehard pool people. I'll be in Chicago again in October 2011 and I'm not even considering staying anywhere else even though this trip will be on my employer's nickel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for the money”
Reviews.Author: dolphinlady63
Reviews.Content: Clean and a good location, next trip to chicago, I plan to stay there again - FREE PARKING

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good price compensate for the flaws”
Reviews.Author: FMUBSU
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in July while attending a conference. I chose it because of its proximity to my conference and its reasonable price. The location is remarkably good. It is within easy walking distance of so many great restaurants, shopping and attractions. The outside is pretty hideous. The common areas are also pretty dingy and ugly. However, the rooms are spacious, recently renovated and fairly comfortable. During a heat wave, the air conditioning unit worked extremely well! The staff is pleasant and very helpful. The free breakfast at the attached restaurant was quite good. When I checked out, I was able to keep my luggage at the hotel with no problem. I left my Kindle in my room. I emailed them and they retrieved it in minutes. Since the price is so low, don't expect a high class clientele. In fact, just follow the overweight, poorly dressed families with screaming children and you will find the hotel. It is overrun with children and babies, so don't expect a tranquil stay. Fortunately, the hotel was quiet late at night. The free WI-FI was slower than dial up. If you need a cheap hotel that is not a rat trap with a good location, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and honest staff, free parking...great find!”
Reviews.Author: pandgora
Reviews.Content: With so many choices of hotels in Chicago, our family is happy to have chosen this one! Clean and spacious rooms with a friendly staff...from the valet, front desk to the maids. The location was in walking distance to the restaurants and shops we wanted to visit. Three blocks from the subway (red line) and two blocks to Jewel (grocery) made it very convenient. The biggest surprise was when we got home. We left a purse, journal and BOSE headphones in a bureau and didn't realize it until we received a call from the staff. A maid had turned it in to the Lost and Found after cleaning our room. It's so nice to know their is still honest people out there.

Reviews.Title: “Very big room, great location...a few quirks but overall a good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: suebenjamin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, July 27-28. As we were coming from another hotel, we needed to either check in very early (9 AM) or store our luggage. Upon our early morning arrival, there were no free rooms yet, but staff members whisked our luggage away quickly so that we could head out for a day of sightseeing. Hotel about a 5-7 minute walk from Red Line. Bus stops are nearby as well. Property has a strange layout; our second floor room was not accessible by the elevator in the main lobby area. We had to exit lobby, walk into parking garage, and use elevator in garage. Our second floor also didn't have ice machine, necessitating another elevator ride/search. Other floors seemed connected - just not the second? We didn't spend much time in the hotel beyond showering and sleeping as we were so busy in the city. The room itself was HUGE - two beds, chair/ottoman, desk, dresser, and still a large empty chunk of floor space. Appeared recently renovated but you could tell it was older property. Overall seemed fairly clean but did notice that our socks/feet were dirty after walking on carpeting. A/C worked extremely well - room was downright chilly when we arrived - but unit was SO NOISY that - when presented with the choice of listening to the heavy thunderstorm or the AC unit for sleeping, we chose the storm and turned off the unit. Luckily room stayed cool enough overnight. Did not get to use pool as we arrived back too late at night, but it was large and appeared well kept.. Pool opened to a rooftop deck with great city views. Be sure to check it out at night or early in the morning. We never even went back to the lobby/main building after checking in, so can't say anything about the staff, etc. No breakfast, but the Rock and Roll McDonald's is right across the street. In addition to the usual McDonald's fare, there is a small bakery counter on the second floor. Other restaurants are close by so you can easily find something for breakfast before you start your day,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, free parking, and awesome staff.”
Reviews.Author: indygirl76
Reviews.Content: When we drive to Chicago we always stay here. The location is close to everything and the free parking is wonderful. Everyone is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and free parking make this one of Chicago's best values.”
Reviews.Author: soxnation33
Reviews.Content: No free breakfast, unless you call coffee and a granola bar breakfast. Very slow elevators. Personable and attentive service at the front desk and at the bar in the restaurant adjacent to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A fine stay at the BW River North”
Reviews.Author: kasaWisconsin
Reviews.Content: First off, this hotel has one of the friendliest, and courteous staff that I have ever encountered. This is an aspect of this hotel that truely stands out. It is clear that management has placed a high priority on their customer service. We were attending the Paul McCartney concert at Wrigley Field and were looking for a hotel with a convenient location, and one that would be reasonably priced. The Best Western River North proved to be just that. The subway (red line) is approximately a 5 minute, easy walk from the hotel and the commute on the subway to Wrigley is less than 30 minutes. The one night rate that we paid at this hotel was very reasonable, in comparison with downtown Chicago hotel prices. The free parking was quite an advantage, considering the cost of parking at other hotels in or out of the city, and the parking attendant was friendly and helpful. There is plenty of eating establishments within walking distance of the hotel. McDonalds is just a few steps away, as is the Hard Rock and Rainforest Cafes. Michigan Ave is an approximately 10 minute walk, with every imaginable place to eat there and along Ohio Street. We found our room to be comfortable, spacious enough for two, clean and had everything we needed. Yes, the rooms are a little dated, and the AC is a bit noisy. But we didn't find that either detracted from the fine accomodations, nor would cause us to hesitate in the least to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: pjpeck
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night Sunday, July 31, 2011, in a room with a king size bed. Also stayed here in April, 2011, in a two bedroom suite. Both rooms were very clean, well maintained, and apparently recently updated. The two bedroom suite had a king size in one room, and two doubles in the other, with a pull out sofa in the living room. Only one bathroom though. It also had a dorm size refrigerator, and a micro wave oven. The suite was on the sixth floor, and we heard no noises from inside the hotel. There is some noise from the busy streets outside, but that is understandable, and not overwhelming. No issues with cleanliness, and the beds were comfortable, with good linen and towels. The room with the king size bed was also on the sixth floor (by coincidence right next to the suite we had the first trip). There was plenty of space in the room, and again everything was clean and in good shape. The bed seemed firmer than the king in the suite, but some will like it, like my wife, other find it too firm, like me. Personal taste! The hotel itself is relatively small (for downtown Chicago), but well maintained and clean. Great location, with lots of restaurants and public transportation nearby. Free parking included, as advertised. There are two sections of the hotel, east and west, with separate elevators, like two buildings were joined. They only connect on lower floors. Both rooms had newer flat screen TV's, but no HD programming. Top floor pool is clean and great for kids. No hot tub. There is also a rooftop patio to view the surrounding buildings. The small restaurant on site is okay for a simple, inexpensive breakfast. We never tried the pizza. Free wi-fi worked okay, but the signal was weak on the sixth floor. The employees we encountered, at the front desk and in the parking lot, were pleasant and professional. No "resort fees" or other hidden charges on the final bill. This is now our preferred hotel in Chicago, and we would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: KatrenaT
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel convenient to everything...the Best Western River North is for you. This was our first trip to Chicago and we are so glad we selected this hotel. While the River North is and older facility, it is well maintained and appears to have been remodeled within the last several years. Three adults were in our party and we stayed in a King suite. The suite was very comfortable and clean. Street and hallway noise was minimal. The hotel staff is warm, inviting and very knowledgeable of the area. The hotel is located just blocks from the Magnificent Mile; local and chain restaurants are nearby and both bus and L access are within a few blocks. Free parking and discount attraction tickets make this hotel one of the best bargains in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: lilnation
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel June 2007 and then again in July 2008. If you are Canadian ask for the CAA deals. If you are American ask for AAA. This hotel is located centrally so your walk around the city is great. Close to the Magnificent Mile and all other downtown attractions. It is right across from a McD's for the kids. We did walk to Navy Pier but be warned it is quite a trek only if you are in reasonable shape. If not then take the tourist buses. The hotel was clean; staff was friendly and accommodating. Cost was reasonable for a suite. We did not get the breakfast included so there was a Greasy Spoon right across the street which we went everyday. "The banana pancakes melt in your mouth". They do have a quaint gym in the hotel so that is important amenity. The is also an adequate size pool .Do not get a room facing La Salle there was a bar or club there that would make it irritating to sleep at night because the patrons would make a lot of noise leaving the bar . Other than that had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: pdrane56
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western River North in Chicago for 2 nights and it was a great hotel for price, convenience and location. We were on the third floor in a double room in the annex building (not much of a veiw out the window thought). Rooms are fine, not overly spacious, but adequate for the amount of time spent in the room. Everything was clean and well maintained. The three best things about the hotel are the free parking, the location - near Michigan avenue, the river, Millenium Park and the rooftop terrace. We really enjoyed a nice summer evening up there, eating Chicago style pizza from the restaurant next door, enjoying a cocktail, and watching the lights of the city come on. I would definitely stay here again. Only downside - is I wish I would have brought my own pillow - theirs were way too puffy!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle for a good price”
Reviews.Author: sansunny
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it offers FREE parking for the guests and it is still located right in the center of Chicago. The rooms and pool are nice an clean and the staff friendly. The restaurant in the hotel is quite expensive and not very good. But with so many great restaurants in walking distance, one really doesnt need it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Good room for the money spent”
Reviews.Author: melhall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week and chose the hotel for value. If you are going to Chicago on a budget, this is the hotel for you. You don't pay a daily rate for parking and the hotel is within walking distance of many restaurants, shopping and the Willis Tower. It is a close drive to Navy Pier and the Museum Campus. I agree with other reviewers that the room was a bit loud due to street traffic and the AC unit but this is not something that the hotel can help necessarily. If you keep the AC unit running, the humming from the unit drowns out the noise from the street. The AC worked very well, the rooms were clean, the bathrooms were a bit small, and the beds a bit hard BUT I certainly got what I wanted from the room.....a clean room at a reasonable price. The kids enjoyed swimming in the indoor pool and I enjoyed the coffee maker in the room each morning. The paper was also provided each morning. If you are looking for elegance and extra amenities and have the money to spend on those things, then pick a different hotel but if you are looking for an average room at an extremely reasonable price, then this is the place for you. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for price”
Reviews.Author: beds1996
Reviews.Content: The overall purpose of our trip was to attend my younger daughter's competition. Since my older daughter was planning on meeting us, we decided to make it a mini vacation and take advantage of some of the sites the city has to offer. The Best Western River North is located within a few blocks of the blue and orange CTA lines, making it very accessible from either of the airports. Every morning, we were able to easily walk for breakfast. The free trolley for the Navy Pier is just a short walk away from the hotel. One day we walked a few blocks to the Magnificent Mile, and even made time to enjoy a deep dish pizza in the hotel's Pizzeria Ora. Since we knew that we would spend very little time in our room, I wanted to spend as little as possible on a clean, adequate room. This Best Western met all of our needs and then some. The staff was helpful and friendly, we took advantage of the discounted ticket for some of the area's attractions that are available at the front desk. One afternoon we briefly visited the roof top pool, and were the only people at the pool. I must admit, the view is a little lame thought.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Free Parking”
Reviews.Author: mykcrealtor
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel exclusively for the location and the free parking, both of which we did enjoy. It was a great location for us to catch the trolley across the street at the Hard Rock McDonalds. And we dined at nearby Ginos, Hard Rock Cafe, Rainforest Cafe, and McDonalds, all within a minute walk. It also should be noted that the staff, every single one of them we encountered, was super helpful and courteous. That being said, I would not suggest this hotel because it is very old (don't be fooled by the "remodel") and lacks amenities. I kid you not, they replaced the entire AC unit in our room 2 of the 3 nights we were there! The walls are paper-thin and you can hear every noise around you as if they were in the same room. Elevators take several minutes, even in non-peak times. Also, we found the bathrooms too small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Wsr0224
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend, it has been recently renovated and still looks a little rough from the outside, but TOTALLY worth it. It is located near the Hard Rock Cafe, Rainforest Cafe and within walking distance to so much more. FREE Parking is an added bonus. I can't wait to go back to Chicago and will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “mostly pros, few cons”
Reviews.Author: bzimom
Reviews.Content: All in all I was satisfied with this hotel. The top three pros for this hotel are 1) free parking 2) the roof top pool and deck and 3) the location. My son loved the pool and my husband and I and our older children loved the roof top patio outside the pool. The service was good and checkin and checkout were super quick and easy. The cons I would say are that it is an older hotel and the bathroom kind of shows that although it does look like they have been recently redone. The room itself was nice, nothing too fancy, but that's okay because we didn't come to Chicago to sit in the room! I would probably stay here again because the location and the pool make it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “We had a good stay”
Reviews.Author: SadSadGolfer
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Chicago, we chose this hotel mainly for price, location, and the free parking. This hotel is not new, and by the looks of it, has had some upgrading done in places, so it has a "retro" feel about it, but we found it to be clean and well-kept. We were here for 4 nights, stayed in room 321. Our room had a split bath: the vanity is inside the room, separate from the toilet and tub. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. The elevator is a little slow. No fridge or microwave in our room, which we would have liked. Unlike most Best Western properties we've stayed at, this one has no breakfast - just coffee and granola bars. There is a restaurant attached that served a decent breakfast for a moderate price. The location was good for us: a 10 minute walk to the Magnificent Mile, and plenty of restaurants within a block; Hard Rock Cafe, Rainforest Cafe and a McDonald's are just across the street. There's also a fresh food market just east of the hotel on Ohio St. that also sells beer and wine. We have nothing but good things to say about the staff: always helpful and answered our questions in a professional manner. All-in-all, we were satisfied with our stay. If you're on a budget, but would like to be close to the action in Chicago, give this hotel some consideration.

Reviews.Title: “We always stay here and I recommend it to friends too”
Reviews.Author: cbmae1965
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times, and will always stay here in the future. The value for the free parking and the room rates is a huge bonus. I know that the BW has been undergoing renovations (slowly, but surely), so anyone who has written a not-so-favorable review who had an older room would probably be satisfied with the newer rooms. We stayed in a newer room in April (and I believe also in August of 2010). There have been times that I've stayed in an area that was noisier than others, so I always request to be in a "not so noisy area" and have never been rejected. The parking staff is wonderful, and I have never had an issue with front desk staff. They have always been helpful, too (even when they're busy...which seems like they always are because the hotel is so popular). The star of the place is Wallace the concierge. Anything you have questions on (where to go, how to get there, etc.), Wallace is your man. We always enjoy chatting with him when we visit. We didn't get to use the pool that last time we stayed, but have always enjoyed swimming in the past. The fact that it's an indoor pool is a bonus. The area is quite large and the deck is great. I have checked out other hotels online, but the room rates (and especially the $25+ per day parking rates) make them undesirable. If you're looking for a safe, clean, great location, this BW is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlar25
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be a great value. In addition to having reasonable rates, they also have free parking. The staff was extremely helpful, and we were able to get most of our tickets at the front desk at discounted prices. The rooms are not luxurious, but we didn't go to Chicago to stay in our room! I would definitely stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at an AMAZING price!!”
Reviews.Author: ILTJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel has wonderful staff... everyone is happy, friendly, and glad to help you with any needs what so ever!! They all seem to really sincerely love their job. The hotel is at a great location downtown and perfect for us since we frequent Rick Bayless' restaurants 2 blocks away. It's walkable to the Mile and the river.. we even walked to the beach and Navy Pier, but it was a hike. The hotel is older but very clean! The mattresses looked brand new. The pool is great and the workout room is right by the pool. The workout room is small and can get hot and steamy but we didn't work out so didn't care! Wifi throughout the hotel as well- free! FREE parking is amazing.. can't beat the price anywhere downtown!! We'll never stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “We have only one complaint, but we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Luerlaine
Reviews.Content: The staff is absolutely wonderful! The only complaint is the ventilation system in the room. Very old, loud and distracting, however necessary in Chicago in July. It worked, so I cannot complain about its efficiency. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this Hotel - great price for Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: CanVaca
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel in July, 2011. The hotel is older, nothing fancy, but it is clean and centrally located. The staff is very friendly and Wallace is a great help with answering any questions about Chicago, the sites and transportation options. Bathrooms are small, but not a deal breaker. The tub and toilet are in a separate area, with a door, leaving the sink area open to the room (which makes getting ready easier). Can't beat the free parking and the parking attendents took care great care of our car. Pool area and outside sundeck was an added bonus. We didn't spend much time in our room anyway - there was soooooooo much to do, we were away for the day and didn't get back until it was time for bed. If you're looking for a clean, value priced, centally located hotel, this is it. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The only Chicago hotel for me”
Reviews.Author: shannonbobannon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this awesome hotel 4 times now (we try to get to Chicago every year) and have never been disappointed. People complain about the most petty stuff on these things. Yes, it takes awhile for hot water (there are hundreds of rooms, the pipes have a way to go), the breakfast might not be a huge selection (we always go to McDonald's across the street), the street noise is too loud (being in Chicago, if it wasn't a bit noisy I'd be worried!), the standard rooms are small (I've only ever gotten a standard room with a king size bed and I dunno about you, but I'm in my room to sleep and shower), the view from the room was horrible (not every room can have an awesome view, that goes for every hotel), the bathroom is small (the tub, the toilet, enough room to stand, what more do you need?), service was slow or rude--I have NEVER had that problem. Yes, the elevator is small and slow, but if you're patient, it does get you where you need to go and if you're in a hurry, the stairs are clearly marked. I see people mentioning the disinfectant smell--I LOVE THAT SMELL!! I don't know what it is, whether it's the carpet cleaner, the linen fresh from the cleaners, but it will always and forever remind me of Best Western River North. :) The few times we've ordered room service, it was prompt, still hot and the gentleman who delivered it was polite.
