The gentleman in the parking area are nice. We even had a Wallace sighting!! Wallace has a smile for everyone :) The pool is awesome. The view from the sundeck is awesome. You can walk to everything you need to go do and if walking is too far, public transit is not far away. We parked our car upon check in Thursday afternoon and didn't drive again until we left on Saturday. And we went all over Chicago! Fresh towels, wash cloths, eco-friendly soaps, tissues, hair dryer, iron and ironing board, room safe, single serve coffee maker. And the best thing I noticed on our trip last year--you cannot lose anything under the bed--bonus when you're packing and needing to make sure you have everything! If you're in town for a few days and don't want to drive, invest in a $14 3-day city pass for public transit. Train or bus, unlimited riding for 3 days. Best Western River North--excellent location. Pool, free parking, great service--and you wanna spend an extra $150 because why, exactly??

Reviews.Title: “Well, it was clean...”
Reviews.Author: Wisconsinese
Reviews.Content: I suspect some rooms are better than others. The floor of our bathroom was painted cement, which got slippery because there was no fan to remove the steam. The television was next to the bed, so watching it would have strained our necks. It was tiny, gloomy, and a little smelly.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible noice/vibration, poor service”
Reviews.Author: hkk75
Reviews.Content: â€¢ Clearly identifiable noise/vibration in the room (at the back side of the hotel, room no. 311) - the noice was audible after switching the AC off and even with earplugs on; it was similar to the airplane noise, but of a changeable pattern, which makes sleeping with it impossible; - the vibration was visible on the surface of a bottle of watter standing on the cupboard b/n beds. â€¢ Friendly, but indifferent night staff - over the phone (about 10pm): the receptionist advised to wait 30 minutes after turning the AC off so that the noise disappears; when informed that the noise remains the receptionist explained that till the morning there are no technicians available in the hotel and on call, and that the technician â€œwill visit the room first thing in the morningâ€�; - at the reception (about 11pm): the receptionist explained that the hotel was completely sold out and there is no other room available; - at the reception (2-nd visit about 12pm): the receptionist did not suggest any other solution, e.g. transferring to the nearest Best Western (or another hotel). â€¢ Friendly, but unprofessional management - at the reception (after waiting for a technician till about 8am on the next morning): the Manager was uninformed about the issue reported the previous night; she was surprised that nobody came to check the noise in the room last night; she visited the room with a technician and immediately heard the noise/vibration; she suggested another room, which to the current room wasâ€¦ NOT at the back side of the hotel, but at the street side where at 8am the daily traffic was up to full speed, and where sleeping after a sleepless night was impossible. Being a Best Western Platinum Elite member, I know that every Best Western hotel has a separate owner. I have checked out of the hotel right after the first night, despite that I have booked two nights there. Of course, I was fully reimbursed, but deprived from sleep at the beginning of the last day of my vacation. I booked this hotel because the location seemed good and since the hotel is a PLUS Best Western hotel. This place deserves a MINUS.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: GoodyearGirl
Reviews.Content: We drove to Illinois for a graduation and planned to meet with family for three days in Chicago. The majority of area hotels were booked, but this hotel had vacancies so we reserved the rooms. I was impressed with the location of the hotel, it was across the street from the Rock N Roll McDonalds, Rainforest Cafe and Walgreens, and it was within walking distance of so many of the city's highlights. The hotel itself was clean, but it was definitely old. It had a very musty smell, which they attempted to cover with some sort of perfumed disinfectant throughout the hotel which was so strong it was sickening. We brought the odor home on all of our belongings. The bathroom could have used some updating and the toilet gurgled all night. We had to keep the bathroom door closed so we could drown out the noise. The elevator was extremely tiny and slow, it was faster to use the stairs. Free parking was provided, which is highly unusual for a Chicago hotel. The restaurant and bar staff were very friendly and personable. The food and service were great. I can't say the same for the front desk staff. They weren't downright rude, but they made us feel like we weren't truly welcome. I wouldn't rate this property "poor" and it's not quite "average" either, but I rated it as such because there is no option for "below average". I don't have any major complaints about this hotel, but I will never stay here again. Luckily, we were not in our rooms for most of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Chicago Hotels!!!”
Reviews.Author: jkesn228
Reviews.Content: While attending our son's graduation from DePaul University in Chicago with family and friends, we returned to the Best Western Plus River North Hotel. After a few stays at this hotel for visits to our son at school we decided this was our best option. The rooms seem to be all renovated and they look Great. New carpet, furniture and bedding. Even carpet in the stairwells.I think it is the Only hotel in town with FREE parking, which saves you about $25 a day A large indoor pool on the top floor with an outside sundeck. Staff were all great, front desk, parking attendents and service rep. Wallace Pope for his help and suggestions. The area is close to all attractions and many restaurants Weber Grill, Texas De Brazil, P F Changs, Pizza Uno, Portellos, Rain Forest Cafe and many bars and night spots. The red line is only a couple blocks away.Tour buses can be found across the street next to McDonalds. Chicago is a Great city and the Best Western River North is a great deal. For your best bang for the buck in Chicago, This is The Place. Jerry in Ct.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TOtravlr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband and our young kids while on a trip to Chi town. I chose the hotel cuz I read favorable reviews from Frommers, plus since we had our car with us the free parking was a deal clincher. The hotel is located in the River North district and is steps away from everything. The location couldn't be better! The rock 'n roll McDonalds is across the street, and several of Chicago`s top dining spots are a short walk away (Gino`s East, Pizzeria Uno, Due, Xoco, Frontera, Portillo`s...you name it)! The lobby is clean and nicely decorated. They also had complimentary coffee and tea. The room was clean and very spacious and appeared to have been recently refurbished. The decor was nice, and I liked the fact that there was a sink in the bathroom as well as one in the vanity area, so two people could get ready at the same time! Rooms are not as nice as say the Westin or Marriott, but for the price paid it was everything I expected and then some. The free parking was such a bonus! We could leave our car at the hotel and walk to all of Chicago`s major attractions (we walked to the John Hancock, mag mile, Navy Pier, Millenium park and the Loop area--with kids)! The rooftop patio is very nice and you can get some nice pictures from up there. The kids really enjoyed the pool and my hubby also used the workout room. Overall, would definitely recommend staying here and wouldn`t hesitate to return on a future trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Will Definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: deadhead30
Reviews.Content: We (4 people) stayed here for 2 nights. Room was nice and big (although not all of the rooms were as big as ours, we did just get lucky to have an over-sized room). Everything was clean, beds were very comfortable. We checked around the mattresses for bedbugs (I always do this no matter where I stay) and the mattresses looked brand new. Beds were doubles, not queens, which was fine for us, but might not be for everyone. The building itself is a little rundown, but clean, and our room was perfectly fine. AC worked great, we had two sinks which was helpful with 4 women, and the shower was great. Pool area was rather dismal-looking. I can't really put my finger on it, just wasn't anywhere I wanted to hang out. I worked out both mornings in the workout room. They have an elliptical, treadmill, recumbant bike, and a resistance machine. Equipment was nice and new, but the room was SMALL and got extremely hot and stuffy. Cannot even imagine how it would be with 2 or 3 people working out at the same time. There's a water cooler in there though, with nice fresh cold water, which was appreciated! We will definitely return, as the location and price cannot be beat. We walked everywhere, to the beach, to Michigan Ave, to restaurants, and it was very convenient to my favorite restaurants, Topolobampo and Frontera Grill on Clark St. Disappointments were: no breakfast, and no hot tub in the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: SPenhale
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious and clean, so close to everything, would stay again. Staff and especially baggage man was super nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and location.”
Reviews.Author: hairfairy17
Reviews.Content: Great stay located near alot of things and near a hop on and off double decker. Ginos east and pizzaria uno super close. Free parking as well. Walking distance to many places. Must see the blue man group and skydeck ledge.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value. Will come back”
Reviews.Author: Trisha_in_DC
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Tripadvisor users, I found this hotel when looking for a hotel in downtown Chicago. Three strong points of this hotel: complimentary parking, good location and clean room. - Complimentary parking: other more expensive hotels in downtown Chicago still require a paying parking, so I think this hotel is a rare gem in downtown Chicago. I read some other comments stating that it took literally hours to get a car from the parking garage. We did not have this problem (--probably because we did not travel in the summer?). - Good location: Art Institute of Chicago, Navy Pier and Goal Coast are just within walking distance from the hotel. You can find good restaurants nearby (such as Rainforest & Maggiano's Little Italy). The most important thing is that Mag mile is just few blocks away! We left our rental car at the hotel and visited Chicago mostly by foot. Only when we wanted to visit a farther neighborhood, we got the car with no charge. A supermarket is also closeby and it is practical for us who travelled with a baby. - Clean room: yes, the room is clean & comfortable. The bathroom is clean although I am not big fan of that black painted floor. The fridge is a bit tired. No microwave (not practical for moms who need to heat up baby bottle). The employees are friendly and helpful. As I expected, we could hear the noise from the street, especially when big motorcycles passed by. However, we were too tired from the walk during the day so it is not a big deal. The thing that bothered me most is the smell of the hotel. The hallway smelled like a very strong perfume, very close to insecticide, when we arrived. The following day, the smell was not that strong anymore. The hallway is a bit tired too but it is acceptable. There is a pool but we did not have time to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It, Highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: cllnsn2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed Sunday May 29th through June 2nd 2011. We got there about 2 hours before check in and they gave us a room. The car was parked for free and we were able to keep the car there on the day of check out until 12:30pm. We didnt need to keep it there any longer and they told us they would let us keep it there until 5pm. We were able to get discounted tickets to the Shedd and the Field Museum. With in walking distance of many good restaurants. It was very quiet there. We didnt hear a lot of extra noise, we were right by the elevator and we didnt hear it opening and closing or anything like that. We could hardly hear anyone out in the hall it is that sound proof and a lot of hotels I have stayed in are so noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jakebrat
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chicago. The price was right, free parking and great location near Mag mile and lots of great restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Frutta00
Reviews.Content: I and 4 other friends stayed here for the weekend of April 29 and we were pleasantly surprised as to how nice our stay was. Service: Fantastic! The hotel staff accommodated us with of our needs, being a larger group. Upon contacting the main desk, they immediately supplied us with extra towels, pillows, blankets. I cannot stress enough to how kind all the staff members were. Room: We stayed in the King suite. It's not the Ritz, but it was sufficient and was fairly large. Large in room safe and fridge were included. Beds were very comfortable as well. Location: Good. Ohio St. is located right off the exit, so you don't have to deal with a lot of major traffic. It is walking distance from Michigan Ave(magnificent mile), Pizzeria Uno, Portillo's, Hard Rock Cafe, Rainforest Cafe, McDonalds, and a local grocery store. Parking: Free for one car. Similar to what another reviewer stated, they allowed us keep our car there on checkout day for free until 5:00pm if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location that offers free parking!!!”
Reviews.Author: CSSNAKEW
Reviews.Content: I wrote one review for this place few days ago and somehow it didn't get posted. Anyway, we are a family of four adults and had just recently spent a week vacation in Chicago. This hotel's location is great and it is less than 10 minutes walk to Michigan Ave., and from there, you can get bus to almost all the major sightseeing such as the Field Museum, Navvy Pier, ect.). Most important, this hotel is probably the ONLY hotel that offers Free Parking in downtown Chicago. The staff here are very friendly and helpful. The room is clean and nice! We liked here quite a lot!!! I do need to point out a few things: They don't have laundry machine in the hotel, the closest one is about 5 - 10 minutes driving distant from the hotel. It is nice and cheap, but you will need a car to get over to the laundry place. Please just ask the front desk staff and they will definitely help you out like they did to us. :] The room doesn't has microwave, and the coffee makers can only make 1 cup at a time, but they do have a place in the lobby that you can make tea, hot chocolate or coffee for free. Also, you can always ask the front desk staff to warm up some food for you if you really need the microwave :] One thing that bothers me is you can hear quite well when people are talking or walking in the hall way. Most of the time, it is okay, but when you have a noise/drunk neighbor next door, that could become a small problem! However, I would highly recommended this hotel to both business and leisure travelers, especially, if you are driving into Chicago! It is not that easy to find free parking hotels these days here.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit to the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: JamesAlvin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very happy with the accommodations at this Hotel. All the staff was exceptionally courteous and helpful. The room was very comfortable and clean. We wanted downtown accommodations that were affordable and this hotel was just what we were looking for. We will definitely stay at this hotel on the next trip into Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A nice choice for a downtown stay.”
Reviews.Author: versejer2911
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the last weekend in March for two nights. We wanted to be close to the loop area and not have to spend a lot to do so. This hotel worked nicely for that purpose. It is actually a very good location. You are close to all forms of public transit, so you can park your car in the FREE PARKING garage leave it there, Parking most everywhere else is about $22 for in and out parking. We bought a one day CTA pass for $5.75 each and got around that way. The hotel is within a block or two from some great places: Rainforest Cafe, Weber Grill Restaurant, Gino's East, Ed Dibevic's, Carson Barbecue (a must visit), The Hard Rock, Excalibur Nightclub, Sweet Home Chicago House of Blues, etc. The rooms were not huge, but they were more than sufficient. It was very clean, the bed comfy and the service staff was good. We had heard a lot about noise issues, but never had the slightest trouble. The floors were a little creaky up on the higher floors, but we stayed on the second and they were fine. The pool is a little confusing to get to the first time. But there is decent workout room off the pool as well as a nice skydeck, with some good views of the city skyline. Overall, we had a nice stay here and would probably go back in the future. Will post pics soon.

Reviews.Title: “All Good”
Reviews.Author: miriamheapes
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed in Best Western River North last week for five days. We could not recommend it highly enough. The location is superb both for dining - lots of great eateries nearby - and catching the trolley bus for sightseeing. The staff were very friendly and could not do enough for us. Breakfast every morning was delicious with a good choice of food. They also do an excellent choice of pizzas and the restaurant is open all day. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful in booking tickets etc. All in all very good value for money, very comfortable beds and a lovely relaxed atmosphere. Will definitely stay here again when returning to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LoveTamara
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for an adult only getaway! This Hotel is within walking distance to everything! Right out our window was The Hard Rock Cafe and The Rain forest Cafe. Free parking is great and they even allowed us to leave our car until 5 (after check-out) We will be staying here again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: kimmhoffman71
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly, beds comfy, room clean and hotel room service food was good and affordable! We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Older but clean, friendly hotel...we will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: cowwalker
Reviews.Content: 3 adults and 3 elementary-aged kids stayed for a 3 day, 2 night Spring Break. We loved the fact that our two rooms faced each other across a private alcove off the main hall. The rooms were very clean, beds comfortable and pillows large and fluffy. The tv was a new flat screen and there was an in-room safe. Would have been nice to have a small fridge but we did okay without. The front desk staff was exceptionally friendly each day especially Wallace, the concierge. The pool is rather hard to get too from the east end of the hotel and was chilly. No hottub. All in all, I would give this hotel 4 stars out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “amazing property”
Reviews.Author: glassheritage
Reviews.Content: I stay here often and have found it to be one of the best hotel experience ... own a stained glass restoration business and am in Chicago often lately ... the staff here is extremely friendly and helpful ... hotel was recently remodeled, it is very clean and has free parking ... in downtown Chicago, it is the best value for the price, more importantly, it is welcoming and friendly ...

Reviews.Title: “MORE OR LESS”
Reviews.Author: viagemmarco
Reviews.Content: The employees were very helpful and polite. the heater on the room doesn't work very well and the shower water, didn't have a good temperature and the bed and pillows were awful the location is awsome

Reviews.Title: “horrible! Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: dawniegeorgean
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying my car while parked in their free parking was damaged!! They have yet to contact me back I have called and emailed them!! Do not stay here!! The free parking is not worth it when your lights get busted out!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels ever.”
Reviews.Author: Pshine
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Best Westerns and I have to say this was the worst. The building was unattractive, the staff seemed like they hated their job, except Becky who deserves to work in a nicer hotel. The magnificent mile website sited them as a location sponsoring MoÃ«t Chandon specials and upon arrival not one person had even heard of MoÃ«t. My partner called down to the front desk on our last night to request two wine glasses and was told that they had none. I knew this was not true since there is a restaurant attached and I do not take no as an answer in customer service. I then called down and requested them and the room service steward rudely stated that in order to honor my request he would have to charge three dollars per plastic wine glass to be brought to the room but could leave them at the front desk for no charge. I was not happy that the hotel needed to nickel and dime me for such trivial items. I will not ever stay at this hotel and will not recommend it to anyone staying in chicago. Worst Best Western ever.

Reviews.Title: “An oldy but goody!”
Reviews.Author: loricastMichigan
Reviews.Content: River North is an older hotel- the elevator is very small and slow. When you walk in to the lobby, you can feel that the building is older. However, the decor is updated, the furnishings are quality and attractive. This might be an older establishment, but it is well loved and very well cared for. The staff is extremely friendly and go out of their way to make you feel at home. The best feature that keeps us coming back is the location- River North sits just outside the Loop, and has FREE PARKING- something that is nearly impossible to find in Chicago. Both times we've been there, we couldn't check in to our room early, but we could "pre-register"- and leave our car there while we went out on the town. They sell passes for the CTA right in the lobby, and around the corner in the lobby there are brochures for any and everything touristy. Ask at the desk about priority seating at Gino's East- the best Chicago style deep dish pizza around- and you won't have to wait in line! The El and bus line are walkable- about 5 blocks to the stops- and if you won't be done doing your thing until after checkout, no worries. You can check out and still leave your car there until 5 p.m.! Great bargain, decent rooms, VERY clean, and the kids always like the indoor pool. Free wifi throughout as well.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE LOVE LOVE this hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: angierpr
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me state that I rated this hotel a 3 out of 5 stars because that is what it is. Don't let that keep you from choosing this hotel, though. This is our first choice hotel every time we visit Chicago. This hotel ALWAYS has great rates and FREE parking and it's in PRIME location! It doesn't get much better than that. My husband and I don't spend a lot of time at the hotel when we go to Chicago for the weekend, so I don't need luxury. But for the price, this hotel is better than expected!! The staff is super friendly! BIG THANKS TO THE HOUSEKEEPING MANAGER KRISTY!!!!!!!!!! Our last stay was this past weekend and I left my favorite (expensive) pillow there. She called me within 2 hours of us checking out to tell me. They set it aside and a friend picked it up for me. I have never had a hotel "find" anything I've ever left there and I was so impressed with the honestly and prompt attention this hotel gave to my lost item. The rooms are a bit noisy, but it's Chicago....what do you expect. If you turn the fan on on the window unit, it drowns out all the traffic noise and any noise from the hallway. They have a GREAT swimming pool also! I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. For the price, I cannot complain about ANYTHING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Personnel at the front desk are outstanding -- welcoming and personal, always cheerful and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: MEVX2
Reviews.Content: We choose Best Western River North as often as we can when we visit Chicago. This is an older, well-established hotel with a few quirks in the building, but it is a pleasant place to stay. The staff are professional and competent and they make all the difference. If we needed utter luxury, we would make a different choice. At Best Western River North we know we can count on good value and courteous service. We are always glad we decided to overnight here.

Reviews.Title: “A Great base to see Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: EnglishTraveller_11
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was in a great location as it is only a few minutes walk to the "Magnificent Mile" it is surrounded by loads of great restaurants and bars. If you plan to take a trolley tour of Chicago you can pick it up a block away. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was spaceous, clean and comfortable! We were very unfortunate that we were delayed by 16 hours on our way to Chicago. We had 3 nights booked at the River North Hotel and we were originally supposed to arrive at 4pm the first evening. Due to our delay it was obvious there was no way we would be arriving until the early hours of the morning; i emailed the hotel to let them know our situation and when we finally arrived at around 7:30am the next day they had kept the room for us so it was available as soon as we arrived but they had deducted the charge so that we did not pay for the first night. I thought this was very kind as i know that some hotels charge you whether you notify them or not. I was very impressed and i think this shows how genuine the staff/hotel is. One tiny downside was the situation of our room which was on the end of the hotel near a back alley. There was slight noise from the blues bar on the next street over the weekend. Although during the week there was no problem at all. I would definately reccomend this hotel. Chicago was a wonderful city and everyone should visit!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Blueberryfloor
Reviews.Content: We always in different hotels downtown every Christmas Eve. It is our family tradition since we don't travel this time of the year and everyone we know are out of town. We've stayed in different 3-5 star hotels. Upon seeing the location and our room, our 7 year old was ecstatic and didn't want to leave the hotel. That's the first time. We loved the location, the free parking was a great plus especially downtown, the suite was awesome and huge for the price we paid for and the staff were great and accommodating. Will stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very affordable”
Reviews.Author: Oz_84
Reviews.Content: Very spacious, clean rooms. Had terrific nights sleep here and hotel was a 5 minute walk to nearest subway station. Pros: Spacious, clean room, huge bed, location, good value for money Cons: Rude staff at times

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious room and free parking.”
Reviews.Author: Margery08
Reviews.Content: Helpful, friendly staff. Good location for buses--within a block to a bus stop for the Loop; headache-free parking in their own garage. The River North neighborhood is full of restaurants, shopping, clubs, etc., and is still a residential area, so there is activity in the evenings as well. There is access from the lobby elevator to some rooms and from an elevator in the garage for others--we requested and got a (spacious) room served through the lobby, which we preferred for evening access. Pool on the top floor is in good shape.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: chevybb
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews both positive and negative. The negatives tended to go to overbooking---when I see that I figure to book directly with the hotel rather than a site like Expedia and thatâ€™s what I did. We had a two-night stay and it couldn't have been better. We parked the car and left it there for the whole stay, had a great check in and used the public transportation while we saw the sights. The staff was always very helpful--- if they didnâ€™t know the answer to our questions they got someone who did. The only problem we had was with finding our room after the initial check in---we had a fifth floor room and if we went up the garage elevator we came out right by our room---take any of the other elevators and it was a humbling experience that made us wish for sobriety to find our way to the room. I wish they had better mattresses---lots of places fall under this also so I canâ€™t ding them on this---well, I guess I will, my wife insists I make it a point to mention them, not great. I suppose you could spend more money to stay on the Miracle Mile somewhere (and get better mattresses) but the great food and the entertainment within a couple of blocks of this Best Western more than make up for that to me.

Reviews.Title: “Shipped me out”
Reviews.Author: rjcaldwell
Reviews.Content: I booked three weeks early to stay here after finding it to be one of the only places downtown without bedbugs reported. Upon arrival, I and a colleague were both informed that they were overbooked and we were sent to other hotels. From other colleagues, it became apparent that they do this quite often. At least they gave me a few bucks for a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for the price”
Reviews.Author: hogansdad
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on the price and some of the reviews that I read. The room was not very big but we did not spend a whole lot of time there. The hotel staff was pleasant to deal with. Be cognizant to watch your hotel charges if you put your room on your credit card. They billed me for a higher amount for incidentals. When I called them they told me that was the minimum they would bill and that I would be getting a credit for the difference. I would stay again but charge the resturant and bar to my credit card instead of to the room and would upgrade to a larger room. There were many attractions around the area and it was easy to find when we took the EL.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: jbb1246
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at Best Western River North. This is a great place to stay for visitors to Chicago who are looking for value. This hotel is the only one that I am aware of that offers free parking for the first car and charges additional $20 for second car. The lot is right next to hotel, street level, monitored by an attendant and is gated at night. Check-in was easy, concierge very helpful/friendly. There is restaurant on-site, but there are a varienty of restaurants/bars all within 4 block radius in River North area. Room was clean and quiet. Medium sized pool on top floor was clean, warm, and has a great outdoor deck for sunning in summer. This is not a fancy hotel, but that is outweighed by the value offered. NOTE: I recommend requesting a room in the main building with pool (larger, updated rooms with easier access).

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel bargain we have ever had in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Nebraskans68114
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best. The room was large with king sized bed with ample room all around. It was very clean. Bathroom was spacious enough. Can't beat the location. Close to the subway and Michigan Ave. Free parking. What more could you want. Great little restaurant across the intersection. Two eggs, two pancakes. two sausage patties and two strips of bacon for $5.25 or $5.75 (can't remember). And it was good. We will certainly stay there again when we return to the windy city. If driving, the hotel is easy to get to and return from the interstate highway. My suggestion: make your reservation now.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, free parking, good price, nothing more”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelmich
Reviews.Content: A clean hotel is a must for us, and this one was fine. It is an older hotel with slow elevators and noisy air conditioners, but it worked for us to do some site-seeing in Chicago. We parked the car for a long weekend, and took the trains and buses everywhere we wanted to go. I think if we do a weekend in Chicago again, we might take the train from Michigan and then stay in a nice hotel by the water for something different. This hotel is walking distance from the Magnificent Mile and lots of restaurants, which is nice. For breakfast we ate at Eggsperience (wonderful! get there early) and McDonald's across the street for something quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: cincinnatiian
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5 star hotel, and if that is what you are looking for, look elsewhere. But I have never been treated better in any 5 star hotel in my 60 years. I booked a room for myself an dmy daughter to watch my son, who was supposed to stay with friends, run the Chicago Marathon. This Marathon has 45,000 runners and 1.5 million spectators. Hotels are booked a year in advance. It should have be impossible to receive special treatment. Not here. They gave me free breakfast when it was not supposed to be included in the price (it was great!), they allow you to park your can, it's included in the price, and go in and out at will. (Saved at least $50 a day and allowed us to explore as never before. When my son's lodging failed, they found me a big room with a king bed and pullout queen - at no additional charge. They let me stay late after the race- no charge and no hassle. Everyone tries to please. The rooms are not fancy, but clean, and there is a nice outdoor rooftop pool deck where we ate our take-out Giordano's pasta before the race the next day. FREE INTERNET. Free computer and printer in lobby. It is easy to get to and easy to walk everywhere from there. Could not have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Free Parking Downtown!!”
Reviews.Author: IUalumni95
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a total of 3 days (Sat-Mon), had a 2 double bed room and traveled with 3 adults and a 3 year old. The room was nice and a good size, bathroom is a little on the small side but there was a sink and mirror right outside the bathroom door that kept everything moving nicely in the mornings. The room was clean and the housekeeping did a good job, there was also a safe in the room for any valuables you might need to store. The beds were clean but a little uncomfortable. The free parking was the big plus for this hotel, you could also have unlimited in and outs and when the hotel was not busy you could park your own car but when they were bust you had to wait on someone to park it for you. Again for free parking it was not a big deal. We did not use the pool or the restaurant so I can't comment on them but we did use the outside deck on the roof and it was very nice at night. Breakfast is not included unless you pay extra for it but there is a McDonalds right across the street and behind McDonalds is a restaurant called Portillo's I would definitely recommend going there and getting the beef and cheese croissant. Walking distance to Navy Pier is about 30 minutes and 20 minutes to Michigan Ave. Overall a good hotel for budget seekers looking to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very affordable for Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TDosen
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this one for the FREE PARKING. This is very rare in Chicago. The location was close to transit (bus and subway) and catching a cab was easy as well as it was a busy location. No issues with street noise except the night that the Blackhawks won the Stanley Cup. Who could blame them! We have small children and there were several restaurants across the street including a McDonald's and a Rainforest cafe. Lots of restaurants and lounges within walking distance, including Portillo's (the hot dogs are amazing!). You can walk to the downtown in 15 or 20 minutes as well. An easy walk. We had a great stay and it was very affordable compared to most Chicago hotels.

Reviews.Title: “ideal”
Reviews.Author: jpe65
Reviews.Content: hotel idealy situated,rooms nice and clean,pool and sun deck perfect for unwinding at the end of the day..free parking a must would recommend this hotel ..would advise you to get bus pass for stay a lot of working involved otherwise and passes to attractions defo worth it ..

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Maggy029
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone who visits Chicago. Very clean and updatd with everything you need. The staff was excellent, very helpful and polite. Of coarse the free parking is a plus. They have a great resteraunt and bar, Food very reasonable and good. I give this a A+.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: dallasgirl03
Reviews.Content: WE picked this hotel cause of the free parking.. our room was soo small. We had 2adults and 3 kids..stuff was not friendly. No microwave,no breakfast,pool was not clean. It was a green looking color. They were painting a few rooms down from us so all we smelled was paint. Just not worth it. Wont stay here again. and the layout is crazy!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Western River North”
Reviews.Author: NoSnowCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed Aug 23, 24, 25. There was a bit of concern because of some reviews, but we were quite pleased with our stay. It is not a high end hotel, however the place was spotless, and staff friendly. The free parking was great, and location can't be beat. We bought CTA passes, but really did not use them much. You can walk most anywhere from the hotel. For the money saved by staying here, we were able to enjoy much more of Chicago. The Blues Chicago on Clark around the corner was a blast as well! (2 nights in a row!) If you want luxury, go elsewhere, but for clean, comfortable rooms, this is a great place. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get any sleep.”
Reviews.Author: mksmom97
Reviews.Content: When we went to check in they couldn't find my reservation that I made 3 weeks in advance.So make sure you have a confirmation number with you. I had to pay 40.00 more and could only get a king bed instead of 2 doubles and that took 40 minutes to check in.We were in the corner room on the third floor and the traffic was so loud I would recommend earplugs. No microwave. The elevators are extremely slow and the hotel layout awful. Not worth what we paid .I will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: lovekin40
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights Thurs - Sunday. PROS: This is the reason we picked this hotel- Great location, average price per day $130 included free parking. All other hotels downtown charge for parking and they were expensive. I would recommend this hotel to others, rooms where clean & price was good. Hotel included coffee/tea/hot chocolate milk and cookies. You had access to free internet or lobby had computer and printer for you to use. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Walking distance to transit, subway and close to restaurants. CONS: air condition was noisy in room and elevators & hallways need updating. If you looking for 3 plus - 4star hotel this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: lucky_charm2300
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for the price. We had three travellers, and the room with the king bed and pullout sofa was plenty of room. (The sofa could only sleep 1 so two rooms would be needed to sleep 4) Check in was a breeze. Access to our room was through the main lobby, but some others had to use the elevator just around the corner from the lobby (Had to cross the drive way) I don't think this was that inconvenient for people as it was an enclosed space. the room included a fridge, safe, large TV and there was free wi-fi in the room. The free parking was excellent, with valet service. The car was retrieved quickly when needed. The concierge Wallace was a great help. He was able to sell us discounted tickets to different attractions. He also gave great tips on getting around the city. The only downside was the maids came very early (8am), but would come back if you weren't ready to vacate. The location is excellent - right across from the Rock & Roll McDonald's (great for breakfast) and the Hard Rock Cafe, Rainforest Cafe and other restaurants. One of the stops it seems on most of the sightseeing tour bus companies is right outside the McD's, so that made it very convenient. Didn't have a chance to use the pool, which is a shame - it's on the top floor (indoor), but had a sundeck and a small workout rooom. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: scottchurchillsr
Reviews.Content: Great location, Great staff, FREE PARKING,Family friendly,FREE PARKING, Nice Pool

Reviews.Title: “Great location, so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: shniglefoot
Reviews.Content: We booked a King suite with a king sized bed and pull out couch. The room layout was awkward in that the sitting area is seperated clumsily from the rest of the room with no reason to want to sit there as the TV and windows are on the far opposite end of the room on the other side of the bathroom (which is incredibly small). The room definitely disappointed. The air conditioning unit is loud and disturbed our sleep on many nights. We stayed over the July 4 weekend which perhaps is why the hallways and adjacent rooms were so noisy on the one night. Also, the proximity to a downtown firehall added to the late night noise, with sirens, etc. The restaurant on site was only marginally helpful in that we used complimentary breakfast coupons (which I found on the web before we arrived) however each day the same dish was prepared differently by the kitchen so we were really not sure what we were going to get from day to day. The nicest feature of the hotel is the 7th floor pool and outdoor deck where you can swim and then head outside for a fabulous view of the Chicago skyline. We also planned a visit to Six flags Chicago and purchased tickets online but were unable to print out the tickets at the hotel's business center due to the outdated software on the available computer. However, the front desk staff were accomodating in helping us by allowing us to email the link to them and they then printed out the tickets we needed. Parking is free which is helpful in downtown Chicago as even the McDonald's restaurant across the street from the hotel charges for parking. However, you need to give the parking lot attendants plenty of notice if you do need to get your car out as they double park many of the cars in order to squeeze more onto the lot. I think I would try another hotel in the neighborhood as we came across quite a few when walking around.

Reviews.Title: “They canceled my room when I was five minutes away from the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MissingChicago
Reviews.Content: I was traveling into Chicago from out of state early Saturday evening and was literally pulling onto Ohio St. when Best Western called to tell me they didn't have a room for me anymore. This is after I had booked the room online and secured a confirmation number. They were upfront in that they had secured another room for me for free - at O'Hare - another 40 minutes away. Well, not wanting to drive any further, not to mention the fact that my entire evening and next morning was planned out and depended on a downtown hotel location, I just couldn't accept this proposal. I had two options to call friends that lived closer than O'Hare and that I would rather try them. So, I let the room go at O'Hare. Sad to say, I couldn't reach any of my friends, so swallowing my pride, I called Best Western back. Sorry, the room had been released and I would have to make any reservations myself now and pay for the room myself. I explained that I had a wife with me, a two year old, and a 6 week old and had no other options. Sorry, once I released the room they had no other obligation to find me another one or to pay for the courtesy of totally screwing my family and me. Should I have taken the free hotel room at O'Hare from the start? Maybe or maybe not, but what I do know is that this is one of the worst experiences I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Night Manager Rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: danyriv
Reviews.Content: My experience was fantastic. I would like to praise the night manager since she solved a problem I had with a cancellation to my reservation that I did incorrectly. She took the time to talk to me over the phone, understand my problem and within hours provide me a solution, even when it was late at night. She was extraordinary, I wish I could receive that customer service everywhere!!! More hotel related, the location is perfect, nearby restaurants, touristic attractions and bars.Free parking is something you won't get somewhere else, I did a thorough search and no other hotel offers it, at least at that given location. The room was OK, very clean, a little bit small and the air conditioning a little bit noisy, but nothing you cannot handle. I would very much recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased and Would Go Again!”
Reviews.Author: RCMommy
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms and friendly staff. Excellent location! Numerous restaraunts very nearby, Michigan Ave within walking distance. City buses and tourist bus stops right across the street. Free parking you just can't beat! The housekeepers did a great job and the parking staff never complained or grumbled the few times we did want our car out. (sometimes we were blocked in, but they pulled it out for us) The restaraunt attached left a little to be desired but in a pinch the food was acceptable enough. Most times we walked to another place nearby. Our only real issue was the pool was very chilly. We also had a very difficult time connecting to the internet every night. I wish the Best Western we stayed at in Michigan on the way down was as nice as this one, but sadly it was a far cry from it. River North is not fancy and frilly, but it is clean and affordable and I will take that anyday!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great deal. Comfy but not too fancy.”
Reviews.Author: DeeDeeH_10
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay. Very close to subway, delicious restaurants and magnificent mile. And you can't beat the free parking in the city! Room seemed extra spacious because of the king size bed instead of 2 double beds. Bed was very comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooftop deck next to pool well worth checking out. Would love to stay here again! Oh, and the city's pretty spectacular too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & Location”
Reviews.Author: letsgetgoing23
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel due to the free parking, this is simply unheard of in a downtown Chicago hotel. Great customer service very friendly and helpful, met the owner upon arrival pleasant and very professional. We got the deluxe over sized king room w/ sleeper sofa (The largest hotel room we've stayed in...ever) nice comfortable bed, flat screen tv w/ free HBO, free internet, and in room safe. The only issue we had was with the air conditioner (VERY NOISY) leave it on and tolarate the noise or turn it off and burn up :-( either way you won't get much sleep. Other than that we would stay here again (with earplugs) and recommend to anyone on a budget looking to explore the downtown Chicago area by foot.

Reviews.Title: “excelent!”
Reviews.Author: Jstvang
Reviews.Content: very well situated in downtown. very big room. very little price ! I had a room at streetside but no problem with the traffic sounds! but.. the keycards for the rooms... the failed to work... often! restaurants for diner and breakfast shopping public transportation... all at walking distance! you can park your car (for free) and leave it there.. you dont need it!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff- Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MrsWard66
Reviews.Content: Thank you- we printed and used the free upgrade. It was great! Room was clean and comfortable. Great pool and deck area. Wallace was very helpful in setting up tours and getting tickets to see the Sox! Great location- excellent value for the money and free parking to boot! Lynn C Michigan

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff...still a Best Western.”
Reviews.Author: life_is_my_vacation
Reviews.Content: The Best Western River North is in a great location, just five or six blocks from Michigan Avenue, to the east, and the Chicago River, to the south. Additionally, the staff is very friendly and the hotel offers free parking and free wi-fi. However, that's about all it has going for it. Is is, after all, still just a Best Western, a no frills accommodation for those looking for merely a place to crash at the end of a long day. The rooms are mediocre, with so-so beds (bad mattresses, decent linens), VERY loud A/C units (I'd hate to stay here in the thick of summer...I'd have to choose between A/C or quiet for sleep), and tiny bathrooms with little counter space. They do have nice flat screen TVs, though. If you're not planning on spending much time in the room and are a great sleeper, this place would be fine, but if that's not the case, I think you can find much better than this Best Western. I find Hilton Garden Inns to be much newer and nicer than BWs, and there's one right in this area, though I haven't stayed at that particular one to be able to recommend it personally.

Reviews.Title: “free parking, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ShaneRussell
Reviews.Content: Free parking, reasonably convenient location, large, clean, comfortable room, decent and inexpensive restaurants nearby, and very friendly hotel staff. The parking attendants were especially cheerful and helpful, but front desk staff and housekeeping were courteous and friendly, as well. This particular hotel was fine - we would definitely stay here again. The Best Western website, however, is absolutely terrible, the worst and most I've ever encountered ... e.g., tells you that certain rooms are available at the "Internet Only" (i.e., the lowest) rate, then suddenly NOT available after you get to the end of the online reservation process. When I then called their toll-free number for clarification, I was told the room I wanted is actually available, but at a higher rate than was displayed online. Talk about bait and switch! In addition, their "Best Available" rate (the rate category that pops up by default) is, literally, the HIGHEST rate. So, don't be fooled by this - instead, open the rate menu and look at the other (all of them lower) rate categories. In addition, it's very difficult to figure out what the BW cancellation policy is. We had to email them to find out (turns out that it varies by rate category, apparently), then later when I tried to confirm the policy with a BW customer service rep by phone, she argued with me that it was different than what we had been emailed. The BW website seems to be designed (I don't know what else to conclude) to be misleading and dishonest. What a shame, since this hotel property itself turned out to be great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price- Worst Service”
Reviews.Author: Avatar77
Reviews.Content: I had some work at US passport agency for which i had to travel to chicago. I checked a few hotels near by the agency and found bestwestern had a reasonable price($130-$160). But they have the worst service i had ever experienced. When i went to the lobby for check in, there was no body in the reception and 2 guys who work are standing by. None of them cared if we needed some help. After waiting for 15 min and no one showing up at the reception i asked one of the guys if he could help. He then went inside and called somebody up. We checked in to the room and it was descent. There was no water in the room.. So we called guest services and requested for water. No response till 30 min. I called again and then they sent some. We switched on the AC and after 2 hrs , my kid was perspiring in sleep. I couldn't go to sleep because of the sleep. So i called guest service and asked to check the AC. They talked some horse [---] and gave me a wonderful advice .. guess what...all i need to do to fix the issue was to "OPEN THE WINDOW"....

Reviews.Title: “Free parking and great location.”
Reviews.Author: RedHeadedGidget
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after attending a conference at a different hotel. We couldn't afford to pay $50 a day in parking and we found this place instead. We found a suite upgrade coupon on their website and were upgraded after our first night. Location was excellent. Only 4 blocks to a red line station. Rooms are ok. The decor is quite dated. The suites are very spacious and nicer than the room we were in the first night. There is a pool on the 7th floor and seemed to be used a lot. There is also a deck which provides a nice view of the surrounding area. Wouldn't recommend getting a pizza from the restaurant onsite. Very bland. If you want good deep dish, go to Giadarrno's.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more...”
Reviews.Author: dalailama316
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying two weekday nights while in town for sporting events. The staff was extremely helpful and accomodating. The rooms were spacious, clean, and quiet. This hotel gives you great value for the price. I would definitely stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “FREE parking in the hotel parking garage, a great rate, and in a wonderful downtown Chicago location,though not fancy.”
Reviews.Author: Friend1957
Reviews.Content: My husband, college age son, and I stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights in Chicago. This is a nice hotel (not extravagant) that includes free hotel garage parking, which is not that common in the city. Regular parking in the city is very expensive. The location was great, with restaurants and major shopping within easy walking distance. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TVR52
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance (about 10-15 mins) of the the Magnificent Mile, the location is good. Couple that with complimentary guest parking, internet and a modest breakfast and you have what is the best combination of convenience and price in the Windy City. Will definitely go back again. Having a room on the lower levels facing Ohio St tends to be a bit noisy with traffic (esp. emergency vehicles).

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best deal in downtown Chicago!!!”
Reviews.Author: Roadtripgirl71
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago last weekend (3/19-3/20) for my daughter's 18th birthday. She absolutely loved it! I booked this hotel online, not knowing anything about Chicago, and was very pleased with my selection of this Best Western hotel. It was the easiest and smoothest transaction ever. The free parking was the deal breaker for me! The entire staff including the parking attendents were awesome! the room itself was very small, but that did not matter to us because we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. It was very clean and quiet. The location was great also! (right in the middle of downtown next to the Rainforest Cafe and Hard Rock Cafe) We could have walked to everything we wanted to do, however I am recovering from a broken ankle, so we chose to use taxi's. (which were very short rides) I will definetley stay at the Best Western River North the next time I visit Chicago!!! Best price in downtown, and the only hotel that offers free parking AND free wi-fi!!!! Nothing fancy, but awesome for people like us who just needed somewhere to sleep and shower!

Reviews.Title: “All you need”
Reviews.Author: jellybelly999
Reviews.Content: Great location for your trip to see Chicago. Within walking distance to all you need to see.

Reviews.Title: “Depends what you're looking for...”
Reviews.Author: flyeaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight so we could see a concert at the United Center. The pluses: free parking, easily walk to restaurants, bars, the Magnificent Mile, and the express shuttle bus to the United Center, reasonable price, and check in and check out times were good. I probably wouldn't stay here more than a night. We just needed some place to sleep and leave our car, so it was fine for that. Our reservation was supposed to be for a king bed and we ended up getting a full size. Didn't complain because we were pressed for time to eat dinner and catch our show. My husband slept okay, but I thought the beds were terrible. I woke up with such a pain in my neck and shoulders. The safe didn't work; again, didn't have time to complain. The toilet was the kind that are in public restrooms, so that was a little odd. Wasn't the cleanest room ever either. Hair in the bathroom and dust on the floor, but oh well. I might stay here again if I wanted to stay downtown for cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Lumpy Pillows”
Reviews.Author: loufoodie
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was a winner. The location was great for us (we're foodies). It's central to and within walking distance of several local favorite eateries like Gino's East, Al's #1 Italian Beef, Lou Malnati's, Portillos, and many others. For families with kids, there's a McDonald's directly across the street, and it's just a few steps to some of the touristy eateries like Rainforest Cafe and Hard Rock Cafe. The rooms were big enough, staff was very friendly and helpful, and we got free breakfast vouchers upon check-in by printing an email we got prior to the trip. On the down side, the beds were hard as a rock and the pillows were small and lumpy, much like a sack of potatoes. My wife woke one morning with a stiff neck and I had a heck of a sore back by the third night. It is also an older building, and the floors above us creaked a lot and you could hear a lot of noise through the walls. Overall though, you can't beat that price near that location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for First Visit”
Reviews.Author: Jazziepoo
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was awesome and very helpful! It was very clean and u could get anywhere downtown from here in a jifffy... The view was incredible!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: 4nP
Reviews.Content: Older but nice hotel. Our room was just remodeled so it was great. We didn't swim, but pool area looked nice. It was just across the street from Hard Rock, Rainforest, and Mcdonalds. We were glad to be able to walk so close to eat where the kids wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: canadiangirl83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights last March and truly enjoyed it. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to a very large suite free of charge, which had its own sitting area and office space. The staff was extremely helpful. The rooms were clean, and noise wasn't too much of a problem. The only downside was the "free" breakfast, which was pretty pathetic from the restuarant next door. We only ate there once! We were able to get a great deal on parking- it was FREE (virtually unheard of in Chicago!) It was a super close walk to the river, magnificant mile, etc. I would definately stay there again- we saved a ton of money than if we stayed in a "fancier" hotel, which allowed us to spend it elsewhere :)

Reviews.Title: “Best Western River North, Chicago”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night Jan.19th for a private concert at Hard Rock Cafe which by the way is one block away. We had stayed here years before for another Hard Rock Cafe concert so decided to try it again. The hotel is old and a bit dated but the rooms are nice and clean. We were upgraded to a suite with two double beds with our original booking being a standard room with a king bed. Since I was there with my teenage son the two beds worked out very nice and the room was very large and also had a small fridge. There is free parking a huge plus if you have ever paid for parking in Chicago it is atleast 20-30 at most hotels and up to 50 at some. There is a Restaurant attached to the hotel and they provide room service also. The pool is an indoor pool that although the air was cold from all the glass windows the water was tolerable (lukewarm) and provided entertainment for about 20 minutes. Please note that the pool drops off sharply once you go past the rope to 8ft a surprise if you aren't ready for it. There is also a small workout room with treadmills,weight machine and stepper it has a small tv for viewing and towels are provided. There are several restaraunts within a two block radius to choose from. Michigan Avenue and all it has to offer and State Street is within walking distance if you are up for it. The staff was always nice and smiled and said hello or goodbye when we saw them. The hotel was fairly quite although i don't think there were that many people there during our stay. For the price,location and free parking you really can't go wrong at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding time...”
Reviews.Author: honeforDUKE
Reviews.Content: My son and a couple of friends just spent the night at this property after the Duke vs. Iowa State basketball game (way to go Dukies!) and I couldn't wait to write this review for the hotel. It was fantastic and for $89 plus tax it has to be the best value in the city. The staff was very helpful, the room was just what we needed to sleep after a long day, the pool was probably the warmest hotel pool we have been in and the fitness room was just right. We also ate dinner at the hotel restaurant around 11:30 p.m. and it was excellent...you have to try the Turkey Burger...very healthy and tasty. The free parking was also unbelievable. You just can't be it for the price and location. For breakfast we ate across the street at the Coffee House...the Duece special...2 eggs, 2 pancakes, 2 sausage, and 2 bacon for $4.75...are you kidding me? This hotel is the place to stay in Chicago! Save your precious money for other things that are way overpriced!!!

Reviews.Title: “Suite isn't quite a suite, but the free parking can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: RainefromNYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel's main appeal is that you get free off-street parking. I've tried to do Priceline, etc before for cheaper rooms, but with parking $25 a night or more, it comes out to the same price anyway. We were squeezing four people into one room--which was described as a "two-room suite"--but it was not a "suite" in the sense of other hotels I've stayed in. There was barely any separation between the sleeping area and the pull-out sofa--it was basically one room. So that wasn't great, but overall it was a good, inexpensive stay in a central location. It was a little bit tourist-y for our taste, and it was hard to find a non-chain/non-tourist restaurant nearby that was open past 10pm (and this was a Friday night!) But it's near the Miracle Mile, etc and is a great location if you're coming from out of town.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: TrishandGordon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great and safe location, in the middle of the restaurant area and a 15-20 minute walk to attractions. The staff are friendly and efficient. The hotel provides free parking and wi-fi, and also has a free large heated indoor pool and gym. We were upgraded to a suite that was spacious and very clean. Great value for money and we would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, good location, great price”
Reviews.Author: ColoMandM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. It's right in the middle of downtown and just a few blocks from the subway ("L train"). There are a lot of restaurants nearby. I got a free upgrade to a suite because I printed a coupon from the hotel's website just before my stay. The room was large, clean, and had a refrigerator. Aside from the older model TV in the room that didn't have a great picture, I have nothing bad to say. The hotel has free internet access in the lobby (sometimes there's a short wait). Rooms that face the street have a nice view, but you can hear some noise. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: RPRBBR
Reviews.Content: We always stay at River North. Great location and value compared with anyother lodging in The Loop or North River. A dated fascility but well worth it. If you like the Tavistock in London or other modest hotels in Europe and around the world, this is the place for you. We would rather spend more money on seeing the sights than spending more on a hotel where all we want is a place to sleep. The staff is very professional and friendly. Free parking is a great deal and the hotel is walking distance to most major sites. On balance, excellent.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better ones in Chicago”
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Chicago on several occasions and River North is truly one of the better hotels in the downtown area. The rooms have always been clean and tidy with comfortable beds and you can't beat the free parking. Also the location is amazing. There are plenty of restaurants, grocery stores, and Michigan Ave. within walking distance. The staff was always very courteous and helpful with directions as well as buses to take to get to attractions that were too far to walk to in the cold March weather. After sampling many different hotels downtown, River North has been one of the most consistent and comfortable to stay at and I would recommend it. It is nothing extravagant, but it is certainly better than most.

Reviews.Title: “The location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: ISellSyn
Reviews.Content: Time and time again I return to this hotel when traveling on business. The location is awesome with many wonderful restaurants and bars within walking distance. The rooms are kept clean and the maids do a good job of freshening them up daily. I also looked at their website and found a coupon to be upgraded to a suite for free which was a nice plus as the room was more spacious and included a refrigerator and a small couch, chair, and table area. Bathroom was nice and clean, bed was comfortable, can't complain about much. It is a little annoying to navigate as the hotel is in two building and only connects on the 4th floor. Also shower pressure and temperature wasn't great and I found it difficult to get the thermostat on a good temperature and was constantly adjusting. Staff is nice and helpful and parking is free which is a good cost savings if you have a car. The hotel isnâ€™t perfect and the hallways are semi-dated but the rooms are refreshed, comfortable, and clean. Iâ€™ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free parking!!!”
Reviews.Author: smiffymiffy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with husband and two young children. Hotel very conveniently located, although we did do loads of walking! It took a good half hour to reach various attractions: the Navy Pier, Sears Tower, beaches; which was fine for adults but kids got extremely tired! Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was good and reasonably priced, and the pool was a real bonus with small children! However, there was no fridge in the room, bring your own or you can hire one for $10 per night. Also, ignorant and mindless fellow hotel guests let down this hotel by being extremely noisy on our second night. The people residing above us sounded like they were having a party at 3am - lots of creaky floor/bed noises, banging around and raised voices above our heads for a good hour or so at 3am!!! And another party were shouting and laughing in the corrider outside our room around that time. I was very annoyed and frustrated but didnt make a fuss as I had two small children in my room. I suppose you get these types whatever hotel you stay in, but it is all very annoying - why are some people like that?!!!. Apart from these mindless people, the stay was fine and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend & stay again”
Reviews.Author: Retired_one_2
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Chicago. My husband & I booked this hotel for two nights and were so pleased with it we stayed for a third night. The room, a suite, was very spacious and clean. The bed comfortable. We were in Chicago for sight seeing so didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel, did use the nice pool one morning. The hotel is an older hotel, but it's what you'd expect in a older building in Chicago. The free parking was a big plus when you find that other hotels charge minimum $48 a night to park in their garage. Staff was very friendly, helpful and eager to please. Complimentary coffee was good. You'll find no complaints here and we do plan on staying there the next time we are in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this, pay for parking at a better hotel.”
Reviews.Author: houseofkrazees
Reviews.Content: Let's go over the good things about the hotel 1st. The rooms are clean, the location is superb, the free parking is great, & that's all. Bad things are: the water pressure for the sink & shower go from low pressure to normal pressure every min or so, and when it does in the shower, the water gets scalding hot. The most important thing in a hotel to me is the bathroom & it was just beyond terrible. They have a soap/shampoo dispenser too, not even actual shampoo bottles & ect. Crazy. Skip this place, pay for parking elsewhere. You won't have people blocking you in where you cannot get out & you won't have these terrible bathrooms. Oh, we also booked a 2 bed room & when we got there, they said we did a 1 king bed, which was BS, & then we had to get a 2 bed smoking room because they didn't have a non-smoking (even though we reserved one). Fail.

Reviews.Title: “First Time In Chicago and Enjoyed It”
Reviews.Author: YeeFamily
Reviews.Content: Nice suite and very comfy and clean. Conveniently located in downtown Chicago. Parking spaces were tight however the good thing was it was free. It was hard to find our room because the structure of the building wasn't ideal. No air conditioning in the halls or elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LovingChicago
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights. The staff was so friendly and helpful. If I ever come back to Chicago I will be staying at the Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Truly awful”
Reviews.Author: wanderingj
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four long nights as part of a reunion. The only thing good about this motel is the location. There is absolutely nothing else to recommend it, except perhaps for the free parking, if you didn't mind that one of the attendants was noticeably drunk at 8 am. This place is badly in need of a makeover in every possible aspect. The very small and ergonomically ridiculous rooms stank of cigarettes, the beds are hard as planks, and the noise from the outside and the air conditioner was deafening. In a word, this hotel is grim.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is clean, confortable, and with a very raisonable price.”
Reviews.Author: poussinette75
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights, and I found the Hotel very pleasant. The staff is nice and some of the very kind and helpful. I suggest it to everyone who wants to go to Chicago, who wants to be in down town with one of the best price if not the best... And the Italian restaurant in the hotel is hummm...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: ed30
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel whichis what you expect from a "Chain" Hotel. Staff friendly, rooms a good size. Location was very good. Good value for money. Pool was a bonus. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust89es
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel and found it to be roomy and comfortable with an excellent staff. Parking was easy, room was large and spotlessly clean, everything worked. Room service staff was great and the food was good to boot. Great hotel, I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & free parking, noisy room”
Reviews.Author: LexiSterling
Reviews.Content: The price for a location like this can't be beat in Chicago, and free parking? Forget finding that anywhere else in the city. But wow, is this hotel noisy. We could hear every footstep of the people in the room above us, particularly when they came in drunk at 1 a.m. and banged around so much we were afraid they were throwing the furniture around. They could be heard talking clearly through the bathroom vent--they were just a bunch of drunk guys in from the bars, but wow! We called the front desk and they said they'd send security to check; after 10 minutes I couldn't take it anymore and went down to sit in the lobby with a book. 10 minutes after I sat down, the security guy came through and the desk clerk sent him out on our complaint; by that time, the drunks had passed out and all was quiet. The price and parking can't be beat, so I might still go here again, but request a room on the top floor!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean, great location and FREE PARKING!!!”
Reviews.Author: larrkon
Reviews.Content: The number one reason we chose to stay here was because the room rate included free parking. Other hotels can charge up to $50/day for parking, which completely destroys the cheap room rate. Very easy to get to (just exit off of I-90 and drive right to the door), room was clean, plenty of room for two, everything worked fine, bedding/towels were clean, decor was basic, view was OK, halls were sparse, elevators and stairs are very confusing, location is superb (right across the street from Rock and Roll McDonald's), continental breakfast was poor, parking may take a while to get your car out (the attendants will double-park cars), and the outside noise can be loud (sirens) at times if your window is open. Overall, not a place I would call elegant, but a great room based on location, price, and perfect for someone who just wants to use the room for sleeping and not hanging out.

Reviews.Title: “It Can't Be Beat!”
Reviews.Author: retiredandlovingit07
Reviews.Content: Each time we head to Chicago I figure the price will have risen, but that's not the case. It's still less than $100 for a double with a king-size bed. There is free parking with in and out privileges. The location is wonderful! The staff is great! There is now a continental breakfast that is included...the waffles are great! It is served in the restaurant, so anyone who wishes a full breakfast can order it. The location is convenient to many jazz clubs, restaurants, and shops. This hotel is within walking distance of Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and decent with the best location”
Reviews.Author: Guelph2009
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay someone in Chicago that is inexpensive, clean and in a great location, with FREE parking, this is the place for you! Within a few blocks of restaurants, the Mag Mile and public transit, we were very pleased with the location of this hotel. It is by no means the Hilton...rooms and hallways are updated but still have that 'old' feeling (and the walls are VERY thin so it's not always quiet). But they were kept very clean by the staff. Hotel staff were very friendly as well. The free parking was a huge bonus as well, that is not easy to find in downtown Chicago. There is a computer in the lobby with complimentary internet access which was very handy. The free continental breakfast wasn't great...the wait staff was cranky and they should at least through some fruit out on the table. We did have hard boiled eggs as an option on the last day which I was happy about, the rest of the week was all cereal, toast and waffles - no protein or fruit. But again, we paid on average about $110-160 CDN per night (changed with the day of the week), so we were happy with what we got. You can get a discount if you have CAA or an AAA membership. Kids under 17 are free so it was perfect for us traveling with our young daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Cheap”
Reviews.Author: baltimoretraveler47
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best value in the area. The rates were cheap and the room was clean. Close to everything - walking distance to good eats, shopping along Michigan Ave., blues bars, train station. Long walk or short cab ride to theaters and other popular Chicago attractions. The room (king bed) was small (ok by us as we weren't there that much), but adequate for two people, nice, and very clean. Hotel was noisy . . . definitely bring ear plugs if you're a light sleeper - between the guests coming and going, housekeeping cleaning, and street noise, there was not a lot of quietness. Hallways and stairwells had strong cleaner (Pine Sol?) odors. Parking was free (practically unheard of in this town), though was not self-park (especially over the weekend they pack the cars into this little lot like sardines). Free continental breakfast (dine-in only with blue tickets provided upon check-in) but limited, i.e. bread, english muffins, hard-boiled eggs, hot and cold cereal and make-your-own waffles. We needed a car to get to the Museum of Science and Industry, Frank Lloyd Wright houses, and Botanical Gardens. We will definitely go back for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “great deal in the city”
Reviews.Author: plan09
Reviews.Content: This was the second stay for us recently and both times we were very happy. The room was very large and the staff helpful and pleasant. The free parking and breakfast coupled with the location make this a great choice in Chicago. We easily walked to the shopping and theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Rob93013
Reviews.Content: Certainly an older property, but well maintained. No charge on site parking. My room over the parking entry area was fine, but it was tough getting enough hot water on a couple of 19-deg (F) mornings. Hotel now includes a continental breakfast -- cook to order available at menu prices. Excellent location. 6 blocks west of Michigan Ave. Rainforest Cafe and Hard Rock Cafe across the street. Chicago Chop house has great food, but you'll pay dearly for it. BW River North is my recommendation for a solid 2-3 star full service property. OH, the roof top pool and deck must be great in summer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and attention by all - Love this location”
Reviews.Author: MIRockHunter
Reviews.Content: This was a family weekend in the big city to visit the museums and my nephew who is there. The hotel is getting old, but clean paint in the hallways, nice room furnishing, huge TV, wifi, clean room with a nice comfortable bed and unit controlled heat all made for a comfortable. We had two rooms. One with a King size bed which took up most of the room and another room with 2 double beds, which was large and held 2 adults and 2 children just fine. Bathrooms are small, but served their purpose. Our intention was to only really sleep there. Great pool was used both nights. Can't beat the free parking and the central location. We loved the choice of restaurants in the area, and it was a few short blocks to great Chicago Pizza at Giodano's. Everyone was super friendly and helpful from the time we pulled into the parking lot, to the time we left. Free breakfast with great cooked to order choices or you can just order off the menue and pay. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
